Magaly is originally from Manabí province.  She has been living in the city of Cuenca for 9 years.  She is a salesperson like her husband and also sells footwear.  She has been in her business for 6 years and she travels round the city selling her merchandise.

This is Magaly's second loan through her community bank and she will invest it in buying shoes so that she has more stock.

Magaly's dream is to own her own home.

loans.use: to buy shoes

loans.name: Wilmer Jhony

texts.es: El joven wilmer tiene 22 años es conviviente tienes un hijo de 2 años de edad, actualmente trabaja Chef es decir cocinero en un prestigioso restaurante, por las noches estudia gastronomia, Wilmer nos cuenta que no es facil estudiar y trabajar a su vez, pero su motivacion para salir adelante son su hijo y esposa, Wilmer solita el prestamo para seguir pagando sus estudios. Sabemos que Wilmer cumplirá sus metas con mucho trabajo y esfuerzo y que los préstamos de Edaprospo le ayudaran.
texts.en:
Wilmer is a young man who is 22 years of age. He is in a common-law relationship and has a two-year-old son. Wilmer currently works as a chef at a prestigious restaurant. In the evenings, he takes cooking classes. Wilmer says that studying and working is not easy, but he is motivated to succeed on behalf of his wife and child.

He is requesting a loan so that he can continue paying for his studies. The staff of EDAPROSPO knows that Wilmer will accomplish his goals through hard work and great effort, and the loans will be a great help to him.

loans.use: to pay for his cooking courses.

loans.name: Bertha

texts.es: Bertha, de 62 años, es una mujer trabajadora, alegre y muy carismática. Vive con José, su compañero de toda la vida. Ahora que sus hijos son mayores y tienen sus familias, ellos viven solos en una casa que es de su propiedad, pero recibiendo la visita constate de sus hijos. La actividad que realiza Bertha es la confección, de edredones, sabanas, cubrecamas, forros para artefactos electrodomésticos y otros. Su trabajo lo realiza en su casa, donde tiene un pequeño taller con las maquinas necesarias para obtener buenas acabados, que son al gusto de sus clientes que en su mayoría son amistades, vecinos y recomendados, atendiéndolos desde hace 6 años. Lo que le gusta de su actividad es el poder dedicarse a un oficio que le gusta, la distrae, y le permite socializar con muchas personas, teniendo buenas ganancias, con las cuales ha construido algunas habitaciones que los tiene en arrendamientos, teniendo así ingresos adicionales. Comenta que tiene planes de abrir una ferretería en su propia casa. Este será el préstamo número 5 con la institución MFP, se siente contenta de contar con un apoyo financiero, y poder avanzar con su negocio, por eso será puntual en el pago de sus cuotas. Con el monto solicitado, lo invertirá en la compra de materiales para su negocio, tales como telas, hilos, elástico, y demás.
texts.en:
62-year-old Bertha is a hard-working, cheerful, and very charismatic woman.  She lives with José, her life partner.  Now that their children are grown up and have their own families, they live alone in their home which they own.  However, they receive constant visits from their children.

Bertha's business is making comforters, sheets, bedspreads, cases for electrical appliances, and other products.  She works from home where she has a small workshop with the machines she needs to finish her products off nicely so that they are to the taste of her customers who are mainly her friends, neighbors and people who she has been recommended to.  She has been serving her customers for 6 years.

What Bertha enjoys about her business is being able to work in a trade that she enjoys and which allows her to socialize with a lot of people and make good profits.  She has used her profits to build some rooms which she rents out.  This makes her additional income.  She tells us that she has plans to open a hardware store in her own home.

This will be Bertha's fifth loan from MFP.  She feels happy to have financial support and to be able to make progress in her business.  For this reason, she will be punctual in making her loan repayments.  Bertha will use the sum she has requested to invest in buying materials for her business such as fabrics, threads, elastic, etc.

loans.use: to buy fabric, threads and elastic

loans.name: Celso Serapio

texts.es:
Celso sigue participando en el banco comunal “Las Palmeras” de la Asociación Arariwa de la ciudad del Cusco. Celso vive en la ciudad del Cusco y donde desarrolla sus actividades económicas. 

Actualmente, Celso sigue dedicándose a la chatarrería. Ya son varios años que se dedica a brindar servicio y le va muy bien. Celso requiere el préstamo para comprar cosas de segundo uso como por ejemplo planchas, televisores, monedas, ollas y otras cosas mas. 

Celso se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Celso continues participating in Las Palmeras Communal Bank of Asociación Arariwa in the city of Cusco.  Celso lives in the city of Cusco where he carries out his work.

Currently Celso continues working in junk.  He has been offering this service for several years already, and it's going very well for him.

Celso needs the loan to buy second-hand articles such as irons, television sets, coins, pots, and other things.

Celso is grateful for the opportunity this gives him and he also is committed to making his payments according to the schedule.

loans.use: to buy second-hand items.

loans.name: Sara Susana

texts.es:
La Señora Sara es socia del banco comunal Medio Ejido, vive por el centro de la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es la tercera ciudad más  importante del país, su gente mantiene la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos y se caracteriza por ser gente amable y carismática.

La Señora Sara tiene 32 años, vive en unión libre y ha concebido 3 hijos de 13, 8 y 5 años de edad que estudian en una  escuelita de la ciudad. Su esposo labora como albañil, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven arrendando.
 
Doña Sara se dedica a fabricar artesanías de temporada como adornos, almohadas, sabanas, etc. realiza esta actividad hace 3 años y trabaja sin horario fijo de lunes a sábados.

Este es su primer crédito que realiza en el banco comunal al cual fue invitada por su cuñada, su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de telas, hilos, ajugas, pinturas, pega y otros materiales para  realizar sus artesanías.

Su meta es tener casa propia.
texts.en:
Sara is a member of the Ejido Medio communal bank and lives in the center of the city of Cuenca.  This city is the third most important city in the country.  Its people maintain the culture and traditions and they are known for being friendly and charismatic.

Sara is 32 years old and has three children, ages 13, 8, and 5.  They all attend a small school in town.  Her husband works as a mason.  They don’t have their own home, so they rent.

Sara makes seasonal crafts, such as decorations, pillows, sheets, etc.  She’s been doing this for three years and works steady hours from Monday to Saturday.

This will be her first loan through the communal bank, which her sister in law invited her into.  She will use the money to buy fabric, thread, needles, paints, glue, and other materials to make her crafts.

Her goal is to have a home of her own.

loans.use: to buy fabric, paints, and other supplies.

loans.name: Ramon Alejandro

texts.es: Las naranjas , bananos , piña, dulces mangos, manzanas , peras y abejas en busca de dulces frutos son parte de los acompañantes del diario vivir de don Ramón conocido como Moncho , tiene 51 años de edad, es originario de Jinotega pero vive en Esteli donde en una esquina del parque central de la cuidad tiene un pequeño tramo de frutas , cada mañana desde muy tempranas horas sale al mercado e busca de frutas frescas y jugosas para colocarla en su mesas de plásticos y vender a todo aquel que pasa por su tramito , la mayoría de sus clientes son trabajadores y estudiantes que pasan comprando su desayuno frutal de todos los días. Lleva 21 años dedicándose a esta actividad, en base a este trabajo termino de criar a la mayoría de sus 8 hijos de los cuales  hay uno que todavía lo tiene en la escuela mientras su esposa se dedica al hogar. El requiere el préstamo para comprar frutas tales como manzanas, uvas, peras, que son productos que no son cosechados en el país y que por tanto son caros, y son buscados por sus clientes e invertir en compra de snacks y gaseosas para diversificar su negocio. Este crédito le ayudara a comprar sus productos mas rápidamente y no perder de vender por falta de productos por lo pronto desea hacer crecer su negocio y terminar de preparar a su hijo.
texts.en:
Oranges, bananas, pineapples, mangos, apples, pears and bees in search of sweet fruit are part of the daily life of Ramón (who is known as Moncho).  Ramón is 51 years old and from Jinotega.  However, he lives in Estelí where he has a small fruit stall on a corner of the city's central park.  Very early every morning he goes out to the market in search of fresh and juicy fruit to put on his plastic tables and sell to everybody who passes by his stall.  Most of his customers are workers and students who pass by and buy their breakfast of fruit every day.  Ramón has been in this business for 21 years and, as a result of his work, he has finished raising most of his 8 children.  Only one child is still in school.  Ramón's wife looks after their home.

Ramón needs this loan to buy fruit such as apples, grapes and pears which are products that are not harvested in their country and so are expensive and in demand with his customers.  He would also like to buy snacks and soda to diversify his business.  This loan will help him to buy his products more quickly and not lose sales through a lack of products.  He soon hopes to grow his business and finish educating his son.

loans.use: to buy fruit such as apples, grapes and pears, and to invest in buying snacks and soda

loans.name: Martha Emilia

texts.es:
La Señora Martha es socia del banco comunal Medio Ejido, vive por el centro de la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es la tercera ciudad más importante del país, su gente mantiene la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos y se caracteriza por ser gente amable y carismática.

Doña Martha tiene 30 años, vive en unión libre y ha concebido 4 hijos de 13, 11, 8 y 4 años de edad, su primera hija estudia en el colegio y dos de sus hijos estudian en una escuelita de la ciudad. Su esposo es artesano dedicándose a la joyería, no tiene casa propia por lo que vive arrendando.
 
La Señora. Martha trabaja con su esposo en la fabricación de joyas como aretes, anillos, cadenas, etc. en plata, acero y oro. Lleva 5 años en el negocio y trabaja de lunes a sábados desde las 10 de la mañana hasta las 6 de la tarde ya que también le dedica tiempo a su hogar. 

Es socia del banco comunal hace dos años y medio y su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de plata, oro y acero  para la fabricación de sus joyas.

Su meta es tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Señora Martha is a member of the Medio Ejido Community Bank. She lives in the centre of the city of Cuenca, the third most important city in the country. The people there still continue the culture and traditions of their villages and are known for their friendliness and charm.

Martha is 30 years old, lives with her common-law husband, and has four children aged 13, 11, 8, and 4. Her oldest daughter attends high school, and two of her other children attend primary school. Her husband is a craftsman and makes jewelry. They don’t own a house so live in a rented one.

Martha works with her husband making jewelry such as earrings, rings, chains etc, in silver, stainless steel, and gold. She’s worked in the business for five years and works from Monday to Saturday from 10 am to 6 pm. She also spends time on household duties. Martha has been a member of the community bank for two years. She plans to use her new loan to buy silver, gold, and stainless steel to make more jewelry.

Her goal is to have a house of her own.

loans.use: to buy silver, gold, and stainless steel

loans.name: Dania Mercedes

texts.es: De Ocotal municipio de Nueva Segovia , es originaria Dania, de 33 años de edad, casada, madre de  1 hijo , ella emigro a la ciudad de Estelí en busca de un futuro mejor , ella empezó vendiendo joyas de plata en su  pueblo pero le recomendaron que se fuer a la ciudad de Estelí donde el comercio de ropa generaba ganancias y se fue probar suerte con lo que tenia ahorrado lo invirtió en comprar ropa nueva para vender. Ahora lleva 5 años dedicándose al comercio, tiene una pequeña tienda frente a uno colegio primaria mas populares de la ciudad de Estelí donde los gritos, risas y juegos son parte de las vivencias del día a día en su tienda. Ella realizo el préstamo para comprar mercadería de blusas, colonias, zapatos, pantalones, camisetas, gorras, calcetines para niños y niñas. Esta inversión le ayudara a mantener surtida de ropa nueva para vender durante estos mese en que las ventas aumenta y necesita vende mercadería nueva para poder sacar adelante su negocio y mejorar cada día su tienda, cambiar su nivel de vida, vivir honradamente.
texts.en:
Dania is originally from Ocotal, in Nueva Segovia.  She is 33 years old, married, and has one child.  She emigrated to the city of Estelí in search of a better future.  She started out selling silver jewelry in her village but they recommended that she go to the city of Estelí where selling clothes makes  profits and so she decided to try her luck.  She invested her savings in buying new clothes to sell.  Dania has now been in her business for 5 years.  She has a small store opposite one of the most popular primary schools in the city of Estelí where shouts, laughs and games are part of everyday life in her store.

Dania requested this loan to buy merchandise (blouses, shoes, pants, t-shirts, caps and socks for boys and girls).  This investment will help her to keep her business stocked with new clothes so that she can sell during these months when sales increase.  She needs to sell new merchandise in order to be able to make progress in her business, continue to improve her store, change her standard of living and live decently.

loans.use: to buy merchandise (blouses, shoes, pants, t-shirts, caps and socks)

loans.name: Ana

texts.es: Ana, de 21 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora y dinámica. Es soltera, vive en compañía de su hermano de 14 años de edad, su tío, su abuelo, su madre, su padrastro y su primo, habitando la casa que es de propiedad de su madre. La actividad que realiza Ana es la venta de cervezas, para lo cual cuenta con una congeladora en su propia casa, en donde puede guardar su producto a la temperatura que le agrada a su público consumidor. Tiene  4 años dedicándose a esta actividad, y contando con la ayuda de su tío en la venta del producto a los clientes. Lo que le gusta de su actividad es el ingreso económico que le genera, y poder apoyar a su familia con algunos gastos, también le gusta el tiempo libre que tiene y lo puede usar en otras actividades como el estudio. Tiene planes de crecer su negocio y convertirse en una distribuidora. Este será el préstamo número 2 con la institución MFP, se siente agradecida con el crédito recibido. Además de sentirse a gusto con su banco comunal, pues considera a sus miembros ser personas comprometidas con sus obligaciones y solidarias. Con el monto solicitado, lo invertirá en la compra de cerveza en mayor cantidad, buscando menores precios, así podrá tener mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
21-year old Ana is a dynamic, hardworking woman. She is single and lives with her 14-year old brother, her uncle, her grandfather, her stepfather, and her cousin in a house that belongs to her mother.

Ana earns her living selling beer which she keeps in a fridge in her house so that it remains at the right temperature for her customers. She’s been doing this job for four years; her uncle helps with sales to her customers. Ana really enjoys earning an income as it enables her to help her family with various expenses. She also enjoys the free time she has to do other activities such as studying. 

Ana plans to expand the business and become a distributor. This will be her second loan with MFP, and she is grateful for the money she has received. She enjoys working with the members of her community bank as they are committed and supportive. With the money from the loan she plans to buy large quantities of beer, always seeking the lowest price so that she will earn the best profit possible.

loans.use: to buy cases of beer

loans.name: Pascuala

texts.es:
Pascuala pertenece al banco comunal “Las Palmeras” de la Asociación Arariwa de la ciudad del Cusco. Pascuala vive en la ciudad del Cusco y donde desarrolla sus actividades económicas. 

Pascuala tiene una tienda de abarrotes en su domicilio pero también se dedica a la venta de verduras y frutas en la ciudad de Puerto Maldonado. Ya son varios años que se dedica a los negocios y le va muy bien. Pascuala requiere el préstamo para comprar frutas y verduras. 

Pascuala se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Pascuala belongs to the communal bank "Las Palmeras," in the Asociación Arariwa in the city of Cusco.  Pascuala lives in the city of Cusco, and this is also where she is developing her economic activities.

Pascuala has a grocery store in her home, but she also sells vegetables and fruit in the city of Puerto Maldonado.  She has had these businesses for a number of years, and they are going very well. Pascuala needs a loan to buy fruit and vegetables.

Pascuala is grateful for the opportunity that is being provided through these means, and she pledges to make her payments according to the established schedule.

loans.use: to buy fruit and vegetables

loans.name: Norma Del Carmen

texts.es: Norma, una mujer emprendedora y luchadora, de 40 años de edad, estudio para ser maestra de escuela primaria, originaria de San Juan de Limay municipio de Estelí, ejerció su profesión de maestra durante muchos años pero la situación económica se puso muy difícil para ella y sus tres hijos ya que ella solo los crio a los tres tuvo que emigrar fuera del país para poder conseguir dinero y mantener a sus hijos , fruto de ese trabajo fue que puso su pulpería ya que noto que es un negocio que te genera ganancias si los sabes administrar entonces noto que era mas rentable ,su hijo mayor le envía remesas ya que el vive fuera del país y le ayuda a ella para que juntos saque adelante a sus hijos menores que están estudiando la secundaria, ya que es el hermano mayor y ha sido como padre sus hermanos. De esta forma ella lucha diario por el bienestar de su familia. Ella requiere el préstamo para comprar arroz, frijoles, azúcar, aceite, productos lácteos, cosméticos  para vender en su pulpería. Ella quiere ver su negocio crecer, ser prospero que le permita pagar los estudios a sus hijos que su principal  meta y vivir de una mejor manera e ir mejorando su casa poco a poco.
texts.en: Norma is a tenacious and enterprising 40 year-old woman.  She studied to become an elementary school teacher.  She is a native of San Juan de Limay, in the municipality of Esteli.  She worked as a teacher for many years, but the economic situation became very difficult for her and her 3 children, because she had to raise them alone.  She had to emigrate outside the country so that she could earn money to support her children.  As a result of that work, she was able to start up a grocery store, since she noticed that this is a business that generates good earnings if you know how to manage it, and  it turned out to be quite profitable. Her oldest son lives outside the country and sends her remittances to help her out.  Together, they are providing for the younger children who are in middle school, since their older brother has always been like a father to them. In this way, she struggles daily for the well-being of her family.  Norma needs a loan to buy rice, beans, sugar, cooking oil, dairy products, and cosmetics to sell in her grocery store.  She wants to see her business grow and prosper, because this will allow her to pay for the education of her children, which is her main goal, and to live better and gradually make improvements to her house.

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, sugar, cooking oil, dairy products, and cosmetics

loans.name: Carlos Josue

texts.es:
El señor Carlos, tiene 28 años de edad, esta casado, tiene 2 hijos de 7 y 14 años,  reside en  una Comunidad rural del Municipio de Taulabe, Comayagua.
su esposa se dedica a oficios domesticos, uno de sus hijos esta estudiando la educacacion primaria.
La actividad que Don Carlos desarrolla es la agricultura (siembra de granos basicos) y la construccion (albañileria).
Ha solicitado un prestamo para comprar fertilizantes que le ayudaran a nutrir mas el suelo para que el cultivo de frijol se desarrolle mejor. El espera vender la produccion a buen precio para aumentar sus ingresos familiares.
texts.en:
Carlos, 28, is single and has two children who are 7 and 14 years old.  He lives in a rural community in the Municipality of Taulabe, Comayagua.  His wife does domestic chores and one of his children is in elementary school.

Carlos is a farmer (basic grains) and works in construction too (bricklaying).  He has requested a loan to buy fertilizer that will help him better nourish his bean crop so that it will develop better.  He hopes to sell his harvest at a good price to increase family income.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Blanca Olivia

texts.es: Blanca es una mujer muy responsable y trabajadora que quiere brindarle a su familia las mejores condiciones. Ella es jubilada pues recibe cierta cantidad de dinero de parte del gobierno, por medio de esto ha podido mejorar los ingresos de su hogar. El motivo del crédito es para la compra de cemento, bloques, arena, madera entre otros. Sus aspiraciones son de mejorar su vivienda pues debido a la temporada de lluvias ha sido difícil pues el agua se filtra es por eso que quiere realizar el crédito.
texts.en: Blanca is a very responsible and hard-working woman who would like to provide her family with better living conditions.  She is retired and receives a certain amount of money from the government.  With this money, she has been able to improve her household income.  Blanca is requesting this loan to buy cement, blocks, sand, wood and other building supplies.  Her aspiration is to improve her home because, during the rainy season, life is difficult as the water seeps into her house.  For this reason, she would like to take a loan.

loans.use: to buy cement, blocks, sand, wood and other building supplies

loans.name: Lili

texts.es: Lili, de 43 años de edad, es una mujer alegre y carismática, además de ser muy trabajadora y empeñosa. Vive con Emiterio y sus cuatro hijos de 20, 17, 12,  y 7 años de edad. Juntos habitan en su casa que es propia. El trabajo que realiza Lili es la venta de abarrotes en general, para lo cual abrió un bodega en su propia casa, con un capital fruto de los ahorros con su pareja, y a base de dedicación y trabajo logró hacerlo crecer su negocio. A lo largo de estos 18 años que lleva funcionando su bodega, atendiendo con los productos de primera necesidad a sus clientes que en su mayoría son sus vecinos, cuenta con el apoyo de sus hijos mayores en la atención al público. Lo que le gusta de su actividad es tener tiempo libre para dedicarle a sus hijos. Gracias a este trabajo, ella puede apoyar con los gastos de su hogar, además de que la convierte en una mujer independiente, asimismo ha logrado comprar algunos artefactos electrodoméstico, para poder tener una mejor calidad de vida. Este será el crédito número 3 con la institución MFP, se siente contenta con el apoyo financiero que viene recibiendo, por eso dice será puntual en el pago de sus cuotas. Con el monto solicitado, lo invertirá en su totalidad en más productos para su bodega, como arroz, azúcar, aceites y demás al por mayor, así podrá tener mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
43-year old Lili is a lively, charismatic woman who is also hardworking and industrious. She lives with her husband Emiterio and their four children aged 20, 17, 12, and 7. She sells groceries from a store in her house. She started the business with the money that she and her husband saved up. Through dedication and hard work she has managed to build up the business over the past eighteen years. 

Lili sells basic necessities and her customers are mainly neighbours. Her older children help to serve customers in the store. She likes the work because she has free time to spend with her children, and it brings in money to help with household expenses. The work has allowed her to become independent, and she has managed to buy various electric appliances giving the family a better quality of life. 

This will be Lili’s third loan with MFP, and she is happy with the financial support she has received. She says that she will repay the money punctually. With the loan she plans to buy more merchandise for her store such as rice, sugar, and oil at wholesale prices so she can make more profit.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, and oil

loans.name: Miguel Ángel

texts.es: Miguel trabajador, junto a su esposa tiene como proyecto mejorar la infraestructura de la vivienda. El préstamo anterior fue de gran apoyo para el mejoramiento. En este nuevo ciclo de préstamo será utilizado para seguir poco a poco con la obra de ver su casa construida por completo, compra de materiales de construcción como: cemento, arena, piedrines, bloques, estribu, camisas, tablones de madera, perlines, pintura para perlines, clavos de acero, laminas de zinc, hierro, entre otros materiales que se requieren para la construcción de un cuarto que se anexara a la casa, así obtendrá comodidad ya que actualmente están durmiendo en un solo cuarto con sus hijos.  Agradece a la financiera por el apoyo constante para cumplir sus metas y brindarle a su familia beneficios.
texts.en: Miguel is a hardworking man who, along with his wife, has plans to improve the infrastructure of his house.  His previous loan was a great help with the improvement project.  In this new loan cycle, he will continue gradually with the work of completing the construction of his home.  He will buy construction materials such as: cement, sand, gravel, cement blocks, brackets, steel liners, planks of wood, support beams, paint for the support beams, steel nails, corrugated metal roofing sheets, steel and other materials that are needed to build a room that will be added to the house.  In this way he will have more comfort, since currently he and his wife are are sleeping in a single room with his children.  He is grateful for the ongoing support that is allowing him to meet his goals and is providing his family with benefits.

loans.use: to add a room to his house

loans.name: Maria Teresa

texts.es: Doña Tereza , es un humilde comerciante del sector de Ticuantepe , durante años ah luchado para salir hacia adelante con su negocio , ahora ella quiere invertir en algo nuevo para ella y su negocio como es el cosmético ya que sus clientes pueden comprar tanto para su alimentación ; como su aseo personal , pero no cuenta con el capital suficiente para realizar la inversión , está muy contenta por la confianza y el apoyo que le brinda Afodenic atravez de los fondo Kiva , ya que son muchos los comerciantes que logran mejorar su negocio y a la vez su condición de vida .
texts.en: Sra. Maria Teresa is simple businesswoman from the area of Ticuantepe who has spent many years struggling to make her business successful. Now she wishes to invest in a new line of products: cosmetics. She thinks that her customers spend as much on cosmetics and personal cleanliness as they do on food. However, Maria Teresa cannot afford to invest in these products. She is very happy for the confidence and support shown to her by Afodenic and Kiva for this opportunity for a loan, as many business owners have used loans successfully to improve their businesses and standard of living.

loans.use: to buy groceries, cosmetics, and soft drinks

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy utensils such as pots and cutlery

loans.name: Candelaria

texts.es: Candelaria de 39 años de edad, casado con Juan de 59 años, y fruto de esta relación tienen 2 hijos. Juntos habitan en la comunidad de Otari donde tienen su casa propia. Candelaria, de una mentalidad ganadora, asegura “que su padre le inculcó a luchar por lo que quería". En el presente tiene dos productos que compiten fácilmente con otros productores, vale decir en la producción y comercialización de cacao, por consiguiente sus ventas fueron creciendo paulatinamente, además ya tiene posesion su producto en su comunidad. Siente que ha logrado el primer paso, ahora debe mantenerse en el negocio. Usualmente su producto los vende en los centros de acopio de su comunidad a un buen precio. En un futuro esea incrementar sus plantaciones de cacao con el único fin de producir más para obtener mejores ganancias. Este será su primer credito con MFP, por el que se compromete en cancelar puntualmente el pago de sus cuotas. Con los 1,000 nuevos soles, comprará plantas de cacao para plantarlas en su parcela agrícola.
texts.en: Candelaria is 39 years old, married to Juan who is 59 years old and has 2 children from the marriage. Together they live in Otari where they have their own house. Candelaria with her winner's mentality assures us that her "father taught me to fight for what I wanted." At the moment she has 2 products that compete easily with other producers, namely the production and marketing of cocoa and as a consequence her sales increased gradually. In addition her product already has a great foothold in the community. She feels that she has achieved the first step; now she must stay in business. She usually sells her product at a good price at the collection centres in her community. In the future she wants to expand her cocoa plantations for the sole purpose of producing more for better returns. This will be her 1st loan with MFP and she agrees to make her repayments on time. Wth the 1,000 nuevos soles (PEN) she will buy cocoa plants to plant on her plot of farmland.

loans.use: to buy cocoa plants.

loans.name: Acner Adrian

texts.es: El señor Acner , es habitante del municipio de Veracruz , junto a su esposa la cual labora como comerciante para apoyar con los gastos del hogar , ya que tienen hijos a su cargo y necesitan de su apoyo , los sueños de don Acner es poder terminar de construir de una sola vez la vivienda , agradece el apoyo que le brinda Afodenic  atravez de fondo Kiva, ya que con los créditos anteriores logro realizar mejoras de su casita , ahora el préstamo lo quiere para terminar de construir un cuarto para su hijos ,  lo cual necesita , cemento , hierro , bloques, arena , piedrín , etc.
texts.en: Acner lives in the municipality of Veracruz together with his wife, who works as a merchant to help with the household expenses. They have dependent children who need their support. Acner's dream is to be able to finish building his house once and for all. He is grateful for the support provided by Afodenic through the Kiva fund, since with the previous loans he was able to carry out improvements to his small house. Now he would like a loan to finish building a room for his children. For this purpose, he needs cement, iron bars, blocks, sand, gravel, etc.

loans.use: to buy construction materials.

loans.name: Alexander

texts.es:
El señor Alexander, tiene 37 años de edad, tiene 3 hijos,  reside en  una Comunidad rural del Municipio de Siguatepeque, Comayagua.
Su núcleo familiar esta compuesto por su esposa y sus 3 hijos (18, 15, y 12 años), actualmente uno de sus hijos esta  estudiando la educación primaria.
La actividad económica a que se dedica es la agricultura, específicamente producción de hortalizas (producción de tomate), desde hace 16 años se dedica a trabajar la tierra propia, la que obtuvo  por una herencia familiar.
Don Alexander es muy optimista ya que sus tierras son muy fértiles y apropiadas para la producción agrícola.
Actualmente ha solicitado un préstamo para invertir en la compra de insumos y pago mano de obra para realizar la cosecha.
Espera ahorrar una parte de sus ingresos para crearles un patrimonio a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Alexander, 37, has three children.  He lives in a rural community in the Municipality of Siguatepeue, Comayagua.  His nuclear family is composed of his wife and three children (18, 15 and 12 years old); one of his sons is currently attending elementary school.

His economic activity is farming, specifically growing vegetables (tomatoes).  He’s been farming on his own lands that he acquired through a family inheritance for 16 years.

Alexander is very optimistic because his land is very fertile and appropriate for farming.  He is currently asking for a loan to buy supplies and to pay labor costs to bring in the harvest.  He hopes to save part of his income to create an estate for his children.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies and to pay labor costs.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
Juan sigue participando en el banco comunal “Las Palmeras” de la Asociación Arariwa de la ciudad del Cusco. 

Juan vive en la ciudad del Cusco y donde desarrolla sus actividades económicas. 

Actualmente, Juan sigue dedicándose a la venta de especias y condimentos. Ya son varios años que se dedica al negocio y le va muy bien. Juan requiere el préstamo para comprar condimentos como por ejemplo comino, pimienta y otras cosas más.

Juan se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Juan continues to participate in the communal bank "Las Palmeras" in the Asociación Arariwa in the city of Cusco.

Juan lives in Cusco, and this is where he is developing his economic activities.

Juan is continuing to work selling spices and condiments.  He has had this business for a number of years, and it is going very well.  Juan needs a loan to buy condiments such as, for example, cumin, pepper and other products.

Juan is grateful for the opportunity being provided through these means, and he pledges to make his payments according to the established schedule.

loans.use: to buy spices such as cumin, pepper and other products

loans.name: Erika Vanesa

texts.es: La señora Erika, es una humilde agricultora de zona de Ticuantepe, por años ah luchado por tener una mejor vida , sus planes hacia el futuro es poder mejorar la vivienda y a la vez diversificar el cultivo ya que la situación del país y el clima ah hecho que los cultivos se pierdan y por ende allá perdidas del cultivo de piña , agradece el apoyo que le brinda Afodenic atravez de fondo Kiva, ya que lo que  adquiere por medio de los préstamo lo invierte en fertilizantes e insumos necesarios para mejorar la vida de la plantación de piña ya que la fruta esta  de muy color .
texts.en: Mrs. Erika is a humble farmer from Ticuantepe. She has fought for a better life for several years now. Her plans for the future are to improve her home and diversify her cultivation, since the current situation in the country and the climate have caused her to lose crops, particularly pineapple. She thanks Afodenic for this support offered through Kiva. She will use this loan to invest in fertilizers and the necessary supplies to improve her pineapple crops, since the fruit is very coloured.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and supplies.

loans.name: Victor Manuel

texts.es:
Víctor tiene 53 años de edad, es casado y tiene 2 hijos. Vive con su familia en casa propia, la cual está ubicada en el Caserío Pueblo Libre Dist. Tambogrande, perteneciente a la Región Piura, ubicada a 4 horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital del departamento de Lambayeque. Víctor vive en la parte rural de este distrito y no cuenta con los servicios básicos.

La actividad que desarrolla Víctor es la crianza de ganado menor (ovinos, porcinos y aves de corral), los cuales al alcanzar tamaño y peso ideal los comercializa en el mercado local.  Adicionalmente es agricultor con parcela propia de 0.62 has, en la cual tiene mango y limón en producción, además de trabajar en un mototaxi la cual le genera ingresos diarios.  Esto le sirve para solventar sus gastos personales y los de su familia.

Víctor desea comprar fertilizantes para su terreno donde ha sembrado mango y otras frutas.  Es por ello que ha creído conveniente obtener un préstamo de 1000 nuevos soles a Edpyme Alternativa.

Víctor es una persona emprendedora y luchadora.
texts.en:
Victor is 53 years old, married, and has 2 children.  He lives with his family in his own house, which is located in the rural Pueblo Libre settlement in the Tambogrande district.  This is in the Piura region, 4 hours from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of the department of Lambayeque.  Victor lives in a rural part of this district that does not have basic utilities (water or electricity). 

Victor is developing a business raising small animals (sheep, pigs and poultry).  Once the animals reach an ideal size and weight, he sells them in the local market.  In addition, he is a farmer with his own parcel of .62 hectares, where he cultivates mangoes and lemons.  He also works with a mototaxi (light, 3-wheeled passenger vehicle) with which he generates daily earnings.  These activities serve to cover his personal expenses and the expenses of his family.

Victor wants to buy fertilizers for the fields where he is cultivating mangoes and other fruit.  For this reason, he thought it would be a good idea to request a loan of 1,000 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa.

Victor is a tenacious and enterprising person.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for his crops

loans.name: Carmen Del Socorro

texts.es: La señora Carmen, es habitante del municipio de Ticuantepe, junto a su esposo , el cual labora como trabajador independiente , ya que tienen hijos y necesitan de su apoyo , doña Carmen desde hace varios años es agricultora , la mayor afectación que se le presenta es el clima ya que en este préstamo pasado se retraso con el pago acordado debido a que la producción no salió en tiempo y forma destinado ,agradece el Apoyo y la confianza que le brinda Afodenic atravez de fondo Kiva , para seguir trabajando su cultivo . El préstamo lo quiere para la compra de fertilizantes e insumos necesarios para la mantención de las plantas de piña .
texts.en: Sra. Carmen lives in Ticuantepe with her husband, a laborer, and their children.  Dona Carmen operates a farm to help support the family.  Her biggest challenge is the weather.  She fell behind on a past loan when her crop failed and she was unable to repay the loan as agreed.  She is grateful to Afodenic and Kiva for their trust and support and for giving her another chance to continue her business.  She will use this loan to buy fertilizers and other supplies that she needs to plant a new pineapple crop.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her farming business.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.es: Verónica es una mujer muy joven D. 20 años que a pesar D. su corta edad es emprendedora y trabajadora. Cuenta su propio negocio D. abarrotes en su casa que elL. misma atienD. para ofrecer un mejor servicio. Anteriormente trabaja en una maquiladora D. L. ciudad pero recortaron personal y le toco ser una D. ellas recibiendo su liquidación lo cual lo quiso utilizar en algo productivo y fue D. L. forma que inicio su negocio.  En este momento Verónica quiere un préstamo para comprar mercancía como refrescos, tortillas, botanas, lácteos, abarrote y mas, D. esta manera su negocio será prosperando.
texts.en: Verónica is a very young woman of 20 who, in spite of her young age, is entrepreneurial and hard-working.  Verónica has her own grocery store business in her home in which she serves herself in order to offer a better service.  She used to work in a cross-border assembly plant but they cut back on staff and she was one of those to receive her severance pay.  She wanted to use this money for something productive and this is how she started her business.  Right now, Verónica would like a loan to buy merchandise such as soft drinks, tortillas, snacks, dairy products, groceries, etc.  In this way, her business will thrive.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, snacks, dairy products, etc.

loans.name: Lourdes Massiel

texts.es:
Lourdes es madre soltera, tiene un hijo de 2 años de edad, ella tiene 25 años de edad, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa, eligio este tipo de trabajo porque le es muy rentable y recibe el apoyo de su hermana, ya lleva en el negocio por mas de 2 años.
Lourdes es una mujer  emprendedora, responsable y luchadora que día a día busca salir adelante ella y su menor hijo.
Lourdes ,  empezó su negocio en el año 2008 , gana semanalmente S/.250 nuevos soles. Con el préstamo de S/. 1500 soles que recibirá gracias a KIVA, Lourdes invertirá el crédito en la compra de mercadería (ropa de temporada).  Su sueño de Lourdes es tener su casa propia y darle una mejor calidad de vida a su hija., su asesor cree es que un excelente cliente .

Lourdes  vive y trabaja en famous Nazca, or Nasca, Perú. The city is well known for the legendary Nazca Lines- a series of ancient, immense and inexplicable geoglyphs etched into the desert surrounding the city, generally attributed to the Nazca culture, which inhabited in the region from 300-800 AD. As such, the city attracts a considerable amount of tourism. But Nazca is also known for its hardworking people, who have preserved despite frequent earthquakes, tsunamis, and a high level of poverty in the region.
texts.en:
Lourdes is a single mother with a two-year old son. She is 25 and has worked selling clothing for two years. She choose this business because it is profitable and because her sister supports her.

Lourdes is a responsible, hard-working woman who tries hard every day to improve her family's life. She began her business in 2008, and she earns 250 new soles a week. With the loan of 1500 soles that she will receive thanks to Kiva she will purchase merchandise, specifically clothing from this season. Her dream is to have her own home and improve her son's quality of life. Her counselor thinks she is an excellent client. 

Lourdes works and lives in the famous Nazca, or Nasca, Perú. The city is well known for the legendary Nazca Lines- a series of ancient, immense and inexplicable geoglyphs etched into the desert surrounding the city generally attributed to the Nazca culture, which inhabited in the region from 300-800 AD. As such, the city attracts a considerable amount of tourism. Nazca is also known for its hardworking people, who have persevered despite frequent earthquakes, tsunamis, and a high level of poverty in the region.

loans.use: purchase merchandise (clothing)

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy bread, sausages, and meat for her business

loans.name: Ramiro

texts.es:
Ramiro es un hombre  muy trabajador, desde hace 2 años se dedica al transporte urbano como chofer de taxi, llevando a sus clientes a su destino por un bajo costo. Para tener mejores ganancias el trabaja día y noche de esta manera para poder cubrir su gastos como la canasta básica y de su casa.
Es padre de dos pequeños por quienes sale adelante para ofrecerles una mejor calidad de vida. El préstamo que solicita es para comprar partes de refacciones para darle mantenimiento a la unidad y así ofrecer un mejor servicio.
texts.en: Ramiro is a very hardworking man. For two years he has worked in urban transportation as a taxi driver, taking his customers to their destinations for a low cost. To have better earnings, he works this way day and night so that he can cover his expenses such as the basic needs of his household. He is the father of two little ones to whom he manages to offer a better quality of life. The loan that he is applying for will be used to buy parts to maintain his taxi and thus offer better service.

loans.use: to repair his taxi

loans.name: Lucero

texts.es: La señora Lucero es una mujer muy trabajadora y emprendedora que no le gusta ser dependiente de su esposo y le gusta ganar su propio dinero aunque la apoya económicamente con que ella desee. Lucero tiene su propio negocio de ropa, perfumes y accesorios de marcas reconocidas que vende a precio de contado o en pagos cómodos. Para ella es muy grato trabajar en el negocio ya que puede convivir con variedad de gente y a la vez ganar dinero. El esposo se dedica al mantenimiento de aires secos, minisplit y es quien se encarga con los gastos de hogar y escolares. Para Lucero es muy importante tener variedad de producto en su negocio ya que tendrá mayor ingresos y podrá satisfacer lo gustos de su clientela. Necesita comprar perfumes de hombre y mujer, ropa de temporada, accesorios.
texts.en:
Lucero is a hardworking, enterprising woman who does not like being dependent on her husband and likes to make her own money, although her husband helps her financially with what she wants. Lucero has her own business selling well-known brands of clothing, perfume, and accessories at discount prices or in comfortable payments. It is very pleasant for her to work at the business, since she can be around a variety of people and make money at the same time. 

Her husband makes a living doing maintenance on Minisplit air conditioning units, and he is in charge of household and school expenses. It is very important to Lucero to offer a variety of products at her business, since that will help her make more income and will satisfy her customers' tastes. She needs to buy perfume, cologne, seasonal clothing, and accessories.

loans.use: to buy perfume, clothing, and accessories for the store

loans.name: Manuela

texts.es: Manuela de 32 años se dedica a la venta de ropa usada desde hace 3 años donde ofrece servicio y buena calidad. Este ingreso que percibe es para apoyar a su esposo con los gastos de hogar y escolares de sus hijos. Es madre y tiene 3 hijos de los cuales quiere ofrecer una mejor calidad de vida y un buen nivel académico. Para Manuela su prioridad es bienestar de su familia y mejor atención por tal motivo inicio con su negocio ya que le permitiría realizar los quehaceres del hogar y atender el negocio sin tener que descuidar a sus hijos. Manuela quiere comprar ropa de temporada como lo es pants, blusas de manga larga, suéteres, chamarras de todo tipo de tallas para satisfacer las necesidades de su clienta.
texts.en: Manuela, who is 32 years old, has been selling used clothing for three years, offering service and good quality. The income that she receives goes to help her husband with the household expenses and the schooling of their children. She is the mother of three children to whom she wants to offer a better quality of life and a good level of education. For Manuela, her priority is the well being of her family and to be able to care for her children, so for that reason she began her business, since it would permit her to complete her household duties and tend to her business without having to neglect her children. Manuela wants to buy seasonal clothing such as pants, long-sleeved blouses, sweaters, and jackets of all types and sizes to satisfy the needs of her customers.

loans.use: to buy clothes for the cold season.

loans.name: Julio Cesar

texts.es: El señor Julio , agradece la confianza que le brinda Afodenic atravez de fondo kiva  ya que durantes varios creditos ah logrado invertir en su cultivo de piña , ya que con las ganancias del credito anterior logro pagar su credito y comprar algunos bloques para mejorar su vivienda y su calidad de vida , ahora necesita financiamiento para poder aplicar fertlizantes e insumos necesarios para combatir plagas y malesas que se puedan presentar en un futuro .
texts.en:
Julio is grateful for the support that Afodenic provides through the Kiva fund. Through several loans he has succeeded in investing in his pineapple crop. With the gains from the previous loan he was able to pay his loan and buy some bricks to improve his house and his quality of life. 

Now he needs financing to be able to apply the fertilizers and the supplies necessary to fight the pests and diseases that may arise in the future.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and supplies.

loans.name: Abel

texts.es: El señor Abel es un hombre muy trabajador y muy responsable con su familia, lo que mas desea es ofrecerles una mejor calidad de vida de la cual de pequeño no pudo disfrutar por la situación económica y que no había. Hace 15 años adquirió un terreno en el cual levanto muros, paredes, coloco su losa y así construyo su casita en la que ahora vive, pero le faltan los detalles para que se vea presentable; como enjarrar por dentro y pintar para esto necesita comprar cemento, arena, pintura y pagar la mano de obra.
texts.en: Señor Abel is a very hardworking man who takes great responsibility for his family. What he most wants is to offer them a better quality of life, which he could not enjoy in his own childhood due to his economic situation. Fifteen years ago he acquired a piece of property on which he raised walls and installed flagstone and thus constructed the little house in which he now lives. But it lacks the details that would make it presentable, such as plastering inside and painting. For this he needs to buy cement, sand, and paint and pay for labor.

loans.use: to buy construction material to plaster walls

loans.name: Jose Luis

texts.es:
osé es un hombre casado, tiene dos hijos mayores  de edad, el tiene 41 años de edad, él se dedica a brindar el servicio de transporte de taxi, eligio este tipo de trabajo porque le es muy rentable.
José es un hombre trabajador, responsable y luchador que día a día busca salir adelante por su familia.

José vive y trabaja en Ica, Perú. Ica is located in the Sechura Desert about four hours south of Lima, the country's capital, and is hailed by Peruvians as "The Land of the Sun." It is known in Peru for its frequent earthquakes (an 8.4 in 2001 and 8.0 in 2007), its production of grapes, asparagus, and olives, and perhaps most notably, as the source of Peruvian's traditional national drink, Pisco. In this hot, arid climate we find the client's home and business.

José ,  empezó su negocio en el año 2007 , gana semanalmente S/.300 nuevos soles. Con el préstamo de S/. 1600 soles que recibirá gracias a KIVA, José invertirá el crédito en la compra de su propia moto, el  sueño del señor José es mejorar el nivel de él y de sus hijos y tener su propio auto, su asesor cree es que un excelente cliente .
texts.en:
Jose is a 41 year-old married man with 2 grown children. He has a business providing taxi transportation services.  He chose this type of work because it is very profitable.

Jose is a hardworking, responsible and tenacious man who strives daily to get ahead for his family.

Jose lives and works in Ica, Peru.  Ica is located in the Sechura Desert about four hours south of Lima, the country's capital, and is hailed by Peruvians as "The Land of the Sun." It is known in Peru for its frequent earthquakes (an 8.4 in 2001 and 8.0 in 2007), its production of grapes, asparagus, and olives, and perhaps most notably, as the source of Peruvian's traditional national drink, Pisco. In this hot, arid climate we find the Jose's home and business.

Jose started his business in 2007, and earns 300 Peruvian soles per week.  With the loan of 1,600 Peruvian soles that he will receive thanks to Kiva, Jose will purchase his own motorcycle.  Jose's dream is to improve his family's standard of living and have his own automobile.  His loan officer thinks he is an excellent client.

loans.use: to buy his own motorcycle

loans.name: Jose Angel

texts.es: El señor José Ángel construyo su vivienda con ahorros para brindar a su familia un techo digno de vivir y un mejor patrimonio. La casa tiene como techo de lámina y madera porque es más económica y en ese momento solo su economía le permitía colocar ese tipo de material. En este momento la madera ya se está deteriorando por las lluvias y ya el agua se comienza a trasminar por tal motivo quiere poner el techo de concreto para que este mejor reforzado y no sufrir las inclemencias del tiempo de esta manera ninguno de su familia enfermaría. Para colocar el techo necesita comprar cemento, arena, cascajo y pagar al albañil que hará el trabajo.
texts.en: Mr José Ángel used his savings to build a home for his family in order to give them a roof over their heads. The home's roof is made of wood and laminate because it is cheaper and this is all he can afford at the moment. The wood is already deteriorating from the rains and the water is starting to seep through, so Jose wants to install a concrete roof so that the roof will be stronger. This way, they won't have to suffer during inclement weather, and no one in the family will get sick. In order to instal the roof, he needs to buy cement, sand, and gravel, and pay the builder to do the work.

loans.use: to buy construction material.

loans.name: Bertilio

texts.es:
El señor Bertilio, tiene 51 años de edad, vive en unión libre con su esposa, tiene 2 hijos,  reside en  una Comunidad rural del Municipio de San Jose, Comayagua.
Las edades de sus hijos son de 16 y 20 años, su esposa se dedica a oficios domésticos.
Don Bertilio desde hace 18 años se dedica a la agricultura, produciendo café y granos básicos (maíz y frijoles). 
Solicito un préstamo para la compra de fertilizantes químicos (urea y formula) para abonar la finca de café, comenta que ya ha tenido experiencia trabajado con préstamos  agrícolas y con las ganancias obtenidas ha mejorado su vivienda y su condición de vida familiar.
Considera que la producción a obtener va ser mayor que el año anterior, por lo que espera obtener mayores ingresos, aprovechando los precios altos que se registran a nivel  internacional.
texts.en:
Bertilio, 51, lives in a common law relationship with his wife and has two children; he lives in a rural community in San Jose Municipality, Comayagua.  His children’s ages are 16 and 20 and his wife does domestic chores.  For 18 years Bertilio has been working in farming growing coffee and basic grains (corn and beans).

He requested a loan to buy chemical fertilizers (urea and formula) to fertilize his coffee plants.  He comments that he’s had experience working with agricultural loans and with profits obtained he’s improved his dwelling and his family’s living conditions.

He feels that the harvest he’s to obtain will be larger than last years’ so he expects higher income because of the higher prices currently in force internationally.

loans.use: Compra de fertilizantes

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is married with three children. She is 50 years old and lives in Cang-alwang, Siquijor, Siquijor.

To earn a living, Josephine engages in snack vending. She has had this business for five years.  Each month, she earns approximately 1,000 Philippines pesos (PHP). 

She has requested a loan of 3,000 PHP to purchase ingredients for her snack vending business. Josephine has been a member of Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative for 10 months.  In the future, Josephine hopes to sustain her business.

loans.use: To purchase ingredients for her snack vending business.

loans.name: Rogelio

texts.es: El señor Rogelio es un hombre muy trabajador y emprendedor, desde hace 3 años cuenta con su negocio de venta de blocks, que el elabora con sus manos y maquinas especiales que lo ayudan. Para hacer este tipo de material se necesita arena, cascajo, cemento y agua que el mismo bate para colocarlo en la maquina moldeadora y lo deja secar al sol para que este resistente. Rogelio compra los mejores materiales para que su producto este fuerte y en buenas condiciones.  En este momento necesita comprar material para seguir generando mayores ingresos.
texts.en: Mr Rogelio is a very hard-working and enterprising man. He has sold bricks for three years. He makes them by hand and also uses special machines. In order to make them, he needs sand, gravel, cement and water. He mixes it himself in preparation for putting it into the molding machine, and lets it dry in the sun so that it gets strong. Rogelio buys the best materials so that his product will be strong and of good quality. He now needs to buy materials in order to keep making a good income.

loans.use: to buy basic materials to make bricks.

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.es: La señora María del Carmen es una mujer muy fuerte a pesar de su edad, hace varios años quedó viuda por lo que tuvo que salir adelante. Desde que su esposo falleció nunca le hizo mejoras a su vivienda ya que él era quien se encargaba de esos detalles, pero ahora ella se ve en la necesidad de poner techo de concreto en su casa porque la que tiene ya está muy deteriorada y en temporadas de lluvia se trasmina por el material que es de madera y lamina. Para poder colocar la losa necesita comprar cemento, arena, y pagar la mano de obra.
texts.en: Mrs. María del Carmen is a very strong woman despite her age. She was widowed several years ago and had to fend for herself. She has not made any improvements to her home since her husband died, as he was the one who took care of these things. But now, she sees that it is necessary to install a concrete roof in her home because hers is deteriorating, and when it rains the water gets in through the current wood and laminate roof. In order to be able to install the roof, she needs to buy cement and sand, and pay for the labour.

loans.use: to install a concrete roof.

loans.name: Roberto Isaias

texts.es: El señor Roberto, es habitante del Municipio de Ticuantepe, junto a su esposa la cual labora como comerciante para apoyarle con los gastos del, ellos tienen hijos ya todos independientes, los sueños de don Roberto es poder terminar de construir su vivienda ya que con muchos esfuerzos lo que ah logrado obtener son productos a la agricultura, don Roberto desde hace años trabaja el rubro de piña la cual se encuentra en un estado muy adecuado ya que este carece de fertilizantes e insumos necesarios para mejor su color , tamaño , sabor , entre otras variantes , agradece el apoyo que le brinda Afodenic  atravez de fondo Kiva para la inversión de su cultivo .
texts.en:
Roberto lives in the city of Ticuantepe, along with his wife who works as a merchant to help out with the expenses.  They have adult children who are on their own.  Roberto’s dream is to be able to build his home.

With great effort he’s been able to obtain farming supplies.  He’s been raising pineapples for many years and he is in a good position.  He needs fertilizer and other supplies to improve the crop’s color, size, flavor, and other variables.  He is grateful for the help from Kiva through Afodenic, that will allow him to invest in his crop.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and supplies.

loans.name: Christy

texts.en:
Christy is from the city of Dipolog. She is 51 years old, married, and has two  children.

Christy have a pig-raising business. She has been engaged in her business for over three years. She earns from this activity 3,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) each month.

She is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase piglets and feeds. She has been a member of Paglaum for two years. In the future, she wants to have more pig cages for the future of their children.

loans.use: To purchased additional piglets and feeds for her business.

loans.name: Ma Elizabeth

texts.es: La señora Ma Elizabeth es una mujer muy trabajadora tiene sueños y proyectos en su vida. Hace 4 años puso su negocio de mercería-papelería y abarrotes donde ofrece   moños para niñas que ella misma elabora y parte de utiles escolares que le solicitan sus clientes y también tiene todo en abarrote en general, refrescos, lácteos,  botanas  de marcas reconocidas a un bajo precio.Elizabeth requiere de un préstamo para pagar a uno de sus proveedores y comprar material de listón para la elaboración de los moños ya que le ha resultado muy bien ya que en este momento esta de moda, de esta manera no tendrá solo los estantes y exhibidores. Necesita realizar esa compra para que su negocio este bien surtido y de esta manera reciba mayores ganancias para ofrecer a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Mrs. Ma Elizabeth is a hard-working woman who has dreams and goals for her life. She opened a grocery store four years ago. She sells hair bows for girls that she makes herself and makes parts of school uniforms that her clients ask for. She also sells all sorts of groceries: soda, dairy products, snacks, and more. She sells brand names at low prices. Elizabeth is requesting a loan to pay one of her providers and buy ribbon to make the bows, since they are very fashionable right now and she has done well selling them. In order to keep her shelves full she needs to make this purchase. This way she will make a better income in order to offer her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy pop, snacks, dairy products and grocery items for her business.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is 38 years old and lives in La Union, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte. She is married with two children.

To earn a living, Victoria has a business selling dried fish. She earns about 3,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) each month doing this type of work. Victoria has requested a loan of 3,000 PHP to purchase more dried fish to sell.

Victoria became a member of PMPC this year (2011). In the future, Victoria would like to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more dried fish to sell.

location.town: La Union, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte

loans.name: Blanca Azucena

texts.es: La señora Blanca Azucena  solicita  un préstamo para reparar paredes de su casa de afuera ya que algunas tienen cuarteaduras y hoyos en algunos lados de la vivienda. Blanca Azucena quiere prevenirse antes  que el problema se agrave  y tenga que gastar más de lo previsto. Ella tiene 3 dependientes económicos de los cuales quiere ofrecer una mejor calidad de vida y para poder cubrir los gastos trabajan en maquiladora 10 horas diarias de Lunes a Viernes. Para realizar su proyecto necesita comprar material de construcción como lo es cemento, arena y pagar la mano de obra.
texts.en: Mrs. Blanca Azucena is requesting a loan to repair the outside walls of her home, since some of them are cracked and pitted. Blanca Azucena wants to fix the problem before it gets worse and she has to spend even more money on it. She has three dependents to whom she wants to offer a better quality of life. In order to be able to cover their costs she works 10 hours a day in a maquiladora, Monday to Friday. In order to make her repairs, she needs to buy construction materials such as cement and sand, and to pay for the labour.

loans.use: to buy construction materials to repair some walls.

loans.name: Cristy Nova

texts.en:
Cristy Nova is a single mother of one 3-year-old child. Cristy Nova is  21 years old and lives in Helen Village, Larena, Siquijor.  

Cristy Nova sells cellular phone load credits to earn a living, and has had this business for one year. Each month, she earns 1,100 Philippines pesos (PHP) doing this type of work. She has requested a loan amounting to PHP 5,000 to purchase load credits for her cellular phone loading business.

Cristy Nova is a newly recognized member of Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative. In the future, Cristy Nova hopes to have savings and not spend too much on expenses for a better future for her kid.

loans.use: To purchase load credits for her cellular phone loading business.

loans.name: Marina

texts.en:
Marina is 30 years old and lives in Ibabao, Siquijor, Siquijor. She is married with two children.

Marina sells firewood for her retail business to earn a living. She has been doing this for one year. Each month, she earns 1,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) doing this type of work. She has requested a loan to purchase firewood for her retail business.

Marina has been a member of Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative for one month. In the future, Marina hopes to sustain her business.

loans.use: To purchase firewood for her retail business.

loans.name: Glorie

texts.en:
Glorie is from Tabuan, Tukuran, Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 31 years old. Glorie is married, and has two adult children. 

To make a living, Glorie operates a cooking business venture, making and selling a variety of different meals to customers in the local community. Glorie has been engaged in her business for over five years, and earns PHP 5,840 a month from these activities.

Glorie is requesting a loan of PHP 6,000, which will be used to purchase additional inventory and working capital. In 2010, Glorie joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory & working capital

loans.name: Byambajargal

texts.en: Byambajargal is 35 years old, and lives with her husband and two daughters in a ger (Mongolian yurt) in Uvurhangai province, Mongolia. Her husband helps with her business, and her two daughters are college students. She started her animal raw hides resell business in 2010. She travels across the  countryside to collect raw hides. Even though she is fairly new to the business, she already has several regular customers; however, due to money problems, her business is very limited. She is a sharp and hardworking woman who says, "I have two kids who are in college. I was a cook in a small cafe, however I have to act agressively in order to support my children." She is requesting 3,000,000 MNT to buy more animal raw hides to increase her working capital.

loans.use: To buy more animal raw hides.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase his own motorcycle taxi.

loans.name: Edna

texts.en: Edna is 35 years old, and lives in Ramon Magsaysay Zamboanga Del Sur. She is married with three children. Edna has a piggery business and earns approximately PHP 4,500 each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of PHP 50,000 to purchase pigs, feed, and vitamins. Edna has been a member of PMPC for eight months. In the future, Edna hopes to earn more for the preparation of her monthly payment.

loans.use: to purchase pigs, feed, and vitamins.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is from Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 61 years old. Teresita is married with four children. 

To make a living, Teresita owns and operates a "sari-sari" (general store) business. The main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Teresita has been in her business for over one year and earns 3,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2008, Teresita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Teresita is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by Teresita from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell.

location.town: Sto. Niño, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Sokhun

She also produces traditional baskets to resell. This couple works so hard every day for income to help cover the family expenses. Sokhun is requesting a loan of USD 1000 to purchase a motorbike for the family's use. By doing so, her family is able to generate more income. In the future, she would like to use any additional income to repair her house. This will be her second loan from KREDIT, a longstanding Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike for the family's use.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a motorbike for her children to commute to work.

loans.name: Sopheap

Sopheap and her husband are farmers. When available from the rice field, her husband collects palm juice to sell. This couple works so hard every day for income to help cover the family expenses. Sopheap is requesting a loan of USD 1000 to purchase a plot of farmland to expand the family farming business. By doing so, her family is able to generate more income. In the future, she would like to use any additional income to repair her house. This will be her first loan from KREDIT, a longstanding Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy a plot of farmland to expand the family farming business.

loans.name: 5.5.39 Điện Biên Thanh Hoa Group

texts.en:

Lan is 49 years old, and she is married with two children. Lan is the group leader of the 39 Điện Biên solidarity group, which consists of five members. 
She lives and works in Thanh Hoa city, an urban area in Thanh Hoa province, with no dependents.

In 2010, Lan joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Lan has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Lan has been involved in this business for five years. The main harship that Lan faces is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Lan hopes for her children to find a good job, for her family to be healthy and happy, and to travel for vacation within the country.

loans.use: to purchase rice to resell.

loans.name: Ruby

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Ruby works hard to support her family.

She has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from frozen foods. Ruby is borrowing PHP 16,000 through NWTF to purchase tools and equipment for her motorcycle transport business.

Ruby has been sustaining her business activities through her past seven loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase tools and equipment.

loans.name: Margie

texts.en:
Margie is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business selling accessories and home products in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 29,500 through NWTF to buy more accessories and home products to sell in her stall.

Margie has been in this business for 7 years. Margie earns a significant portion of her income from buying and selling scrap gold.

Margie has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy more accessories and home products to sell in her stall.

loans.name: 3.2.64 Quảng Hưng Thanh Hoa Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Mùi operates a food stall selling beverages. She is requesting a loan to purchase materials to maintain the refeshment bar (a small bar with coffee, tea, soft drinks and fast food).

Mùi is 31 years-old and she is married with two children.  She is the leader of a five member group, the 3.2.64 Quảng Hưng solidarity group.  Mùi lives with two dependents in Thanh Hoa city, a urban town in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2010, Mùi joined Kiva partner Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Mùi has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

Mùi has been involved in this business for five years. The main harship that Mùi faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Mùi hopes to build a new house in order for her family to be healthy and happy, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase materials to maintain a refreshment stand.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is 34 years old and married with 3 children.

Gloria works hard to provide for her family. She runs a rice retail business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 17000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell.

Gloria has borrowed and repaid 14 loans from NWTF prior to this loan. She has been running the rice retail business for 6 years.

Gloria aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
This is Alice, 57, resident of Pasay City, Philippines. She is a widow with 2 children. She manages her own household while operating a business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income to cover her family's everyday expenses.

Alice operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php 5 worth of cooking oil, or an egg. Alice earns income by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. She also sells cooked foods and viands at an affordable price.  Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php 400 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 17,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and cooking ingredients to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Alice's dream is to be able to grow her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week; she can also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items and products needed for her business.

loans.name: Emilyn

texts.en:
Emilyn is 33 years old and married with 2 children. With 2 children in school, Emilyn works very hard to provide for them.

Emilyn runs a business selling stainless accessories in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy more products to sell.

Emilyn has been in this business for 9 years and sells a variety of items such as necklaces, rings, earrings, etc.

In the future, Emilyn would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more products to sell.

loans.name: Samey

texts.en: Samey, 31, is married and resides with her husband and four children in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia, an area known for quality palm products. Samey and her husband sell food. This couple works so hard every day to earn income to help cover the family expenses. Samey is requesting a loan of USD 600 to purchase shoes to resell which will allow her family to generate more income. In the future, she would like to use any additional income to repair her house. This will be her second loan from KREDIT, a longstanding Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy shoes to resell.

loans.name: Junelen

texts.en:
Junelen is 37 years old and married with one child.

Junelen works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines.   Junelen requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy items to resell like shampoo, groceries, etc., in her sari-sari store.

Junelen has borrowed and repaid one loan from NWTF prior to this one. She has been running the sari-sari store for 2 years and also earns income from raising pigs and selling bread.

Junelen aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to resell.

loans.name: Pagam

texts.en: Pagam is 48 years old and lives with her husband, three kids, and one granddaughter in her own house in Uvurhangai province, Mongolia. Her husband helps with her business, two kids are employed, and the third is in school along with Pagam's granddaughter. Pagam started her secondhand garment retail business in 2009. Even though she is relatively new to the business, she is known for her excellent products. She even disinfects the products; however, her range of products offered is very limited due to financial problems. She is a sharp and hardworking woman who is requesting 500,000 MNT to buy more used shoes.

loans.use: to buy more used shoes.

loans.name: Lilibeth

texts.en: Lilibeth is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a dress shop in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase additional materials for her dress shop. Lilibeth has been in this business for five years, and she also earns income by raising pigs. Lilibeth has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additonal materials for her dress shop.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita, the owner of Leilani's Thrift Shop, grew up in Kauai learning the importance of recycling and community from her mother, Leilani. "When I was younger, I'd complain to my mom about dragging me to second-hand stores and tease her about bringing her own bag to shops. But now…I get it! " 

When Teresita moved to Pacifica, a sleepy beach town outside San Francisco, she brought with her all of the values her mother had taught her. When she discovered that there weren't very many thrift shops in her community, she decided to open up a thrift shop of her own in 2010. 

With a prime location on a busy street right across from the ocean, she named her shop "Leilani's Thrift", after her middle name and her mother's name. The cozy shop is adorned with racks upon racks of gorgeous clothing from the 1950s, 1990s, and everything in between. Shelves upon shelves play host to antique jewelry that would make any grandmother nostalgic. 

In the same way that Teresita's mother taught her the importance of recycling clothing, Teresita has extended this lesson onto her five children and the young people of Pacifica. "I love it when I see high-schoolers coming by, rather than hitting up Forever 21," she said. 

With her $3,000 loan from Opportunity Fund, she hopes to expand her clientele even more with the addition of a "full circle wall", where she will showcase local artists' work with recycled and up-cycled goods. "I absolutely love this one!" she gushes about a handbag made from recycled pop labels.

loans.use: to dedicate a corner of her shop to local artists' work.

loans.name: Tungatar

texts.en: Tungatar is 40 years old and lives with his wife and six kids in a ger(Mongolian yurt) in Bayan-Ulgii Province, Mongolia. His kids are all in school. He started his carpenting and plumbing business in 1996. His service is very popular around the neighborhood, but his tools and equipment are very old. He is requesting 600,000 MNT to buy new tools and equipment. He is a diligent and hardworking man who says "I have many children and I have to do everything I can in order to support them and educate them."

loans.use: to buy new tools and equipment.

Rosel has borrowed and re-paid 20 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running her business of buying and selling root crops for 10 years and also earns an income from raising livestock, charcoal retail and raising pigs.

Rosel aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase more root crops to sell
