Rodolfo is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP  to repair an existing vehicle for better service. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.name: Rosa

In 2010, Tân joined Kiva partner Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women in order to improve her  business. Tân has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Tân has been involved in this business for three years.

The main harship that Tân faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Tân hopes to build a new house, for her children to find a good job, and for her business to do well.

Beverly has been sustaining her business activities through her past 20 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.name: Cerila

Cerila earns more income from fishing. Cerila has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business, and to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: To purchase additioanal stocks of fish to sell.

loans.name: Fe

loans.name: Nang

loans.name: 3.8.67 Quảng Hưng Thanh Hoa Group

Mrs Muôn works in agriculture farming poultry and cattle. She is requesting a loan to purchase baby poultry to raise and sell in the future.

Muôn is 51 years-old and she is married with two children.  She is the leader of a seven member group, the 3.8.67 Quảng Hưng solidarity group.  Muôn lives with one dependent in Thanh Hoa city, a urban town in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2010, Muôn joined Kiva partner Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women in order to improve her  business. Muôn has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  Muôn has been involved in this business for two years.

loans.name: 03 Tây Sơn 3 Phú Sơn 2 Thanh Hoa Group

This is Quỳnh first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women.
Quỳnh has been involved in this business for 4 years.
The main harship that Quỳnh faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Quỳnh hopes to build a new house, to buy a motorbike, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.name: Danilo

He goes down to the field every day to ensure good crops. Farming is quite difiicult as source of income, but Danilo is a patient man who sacrifices a lot for his family. He wants to improve his income because he usually pays PHP5,000 for tuition fees and allowances for his two children. 

Danilo aims to strengthen his business so he is asking for a loan of PHP18,000 to buy fertilizers and insecticides used in farming.

In the future, Danilo would like to keep generating abundant harvests in his rice field and someday improve his living condition.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and insecticides used in farming.

loans.name: Ofelia

texts.en:
Ofelia works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines. Ofelia requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to purchase materials to repair her fishing boat.
She has been in this business for four years now. In the future, Ofelia would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase materials to repair her fishing boat

loans.name: Analita

texts.en:
Analita is married with four children and is a very hard working entrepreneur. She is 45 years old and has children who are in school. Analita has a fruit vending business in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF to purchase more fruit to sell.
She has been in this business for two years. In the future, Analita would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: To purchase more fruit to sell

loans.name: Helaria

texts.en:
Helaria is 50 years old and married with four children, one of whom is in school. She works very hard to provide for them. Helaria runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell in her sari-sari store.
Helaria has been in this business for two years. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy additional items to sell in her sari-sari store

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline is 52 years old. She is married and has four children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Evangeline is borrowing PHP 15000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Evangeline has been raising pigs for 12 years and also earns additional income from food vending.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: To buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Sameoun

texts.en: Sameoun, 43, is married and resides with her husband and two children in Kampong Chnang province, Cambodia, an area known for quality palm products. Sameoun and her husband sell beef soup. This couple works so hard every day for their incomes to help cover the family expenses. Sameoun is requesting a loan of $800 to purchase a plot of farmland to grow rice. By doing so, her family will be able to generate more income. In the future, she would like to use any additional income to repair her house. This will be her first loan from KREDIT, a longstanding Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy a plot of farmland to grow rice.

loans.name: Bienvinida

texts.en:
Bienvinida is married and has eight children, four of whom are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Bienvinida is 45 years old.

Bienvinida has a fishing/fish-vending business in the Philippines. Bienvinida requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to buy materials for the repair of her fishing boat.

Bienvinida has been in this business for 35 years. In the future, Bienvinida would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To buy materials for the repair of her fishing boat.

loans.name: Nilda

texts.en:
Nilda is 46 years old and has three children. Nilda is married and has one child who is in school.

Nilda is in the agricultural business. She raises pigs in the Philippines. Nilda requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Nilda has been raising pigs for one year now, and has borrowed money two times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Nilda would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: To buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma is 41 years old. She is married and has one child.

Vilma is in the agricultural business. She raises pigs in the Philippines. Vilma requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Vilma has been raising pigs for seven years now, and has borrowed two times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Vilma would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Ma. Hennie

texts.en:
Ma. Hennie is 42 years old and has 10 children, five of whom are in school. Ma. Hennie is married.

Ma. Hennie is in the agricultural business. She raises pigs in the Philippines. Ma. Hennie requested a PHP 19000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Ma. Hennie has been raising pigs for 10 years now and has borrowed 14 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Ma. Hennie would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Fausiya

texts.en:
Fausiya works hard to support her family. Fausiya is married and has a fish-vending business in the Philippines.

Fausiya requested a PHP 13000 loan through NWTF to buy additional fish to sell.

Fausiya has been in this business for five years now and also earns additional income from fishing.

In the future, Fausiya would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To buy additional fish to sell.

loans.name: Narcefa

texts.en:
Narcefa is 42 years old and married with five children. With two children in school, Narcefa works very hard to provide for them.

Narcefa runs a business buying and selling dried coconuts in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 13000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock of dried coconuts to sell.

Narcefa has been in this business for 20 years.

In the future, Narcefa would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase more stock of dried coconuts to sell.

loans.name: Mercilyn

texts.en:
Mercilyn is a 41-year-old married woman with three children. She's from Carmen Annex, Ozamis City. 

Mercilyn operates a service-based business, providing transportation services to her local community members to earn a living. Mercilyn has been in this business for six years. She earns 4,000 PHP a month. 

In 2006, Mercilyn joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation as well as her ability to engage in business activities. Mercilyn is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to repair a transport vehicle used in her business. This will be the sixth loan taken out by Mercilyn from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to repair a transport vehicle used in her business.

location.town: Carmen Annex, Ozamis City, Misamis Occidental

loans.name: 02 Tây Sơn 3 Phú Sơn 2 Thanh Hoa Group

texts.en:
Ms Hằng has a retail business selling household commodity. She is requesting a loan to purchase household commodities, in general, to resell.

Hằng is 34 years old. She is single and has 1 child.
She is the leader of a 3-member group, the 02 Tây Sơn 3 Phú Sơn 2 solidarity group. 
Hằng lives with her 1 dependent in Thanh Hoa city, an urban town in Thanh Hoa province.

This is Hằng's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women.
Hằng has been involved in this business for 6 years.
The main hardship that Hằng faces in her business is the lack of capital.

In the future, Hằng hopes to build a new house, to travel for vacation within the country, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase household commodity in general to resell.

loans.name: Tansagbayandalai

texts.en: Mr. Tansagbayandalai, age 34, is a security serviceman and runs a grocery store beyond his job. He has been running his store just for a half year. He lives with his wife and his three children in Kherlen, a western boundary town in Mongolia. He has a sister who has played chess since childhood. Soon she will have the State Chess Match in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. This is a very important for herself. However, there are some financial challenges concerning expenses related to the match. Her brother Tansagbayandalai is planning to pay the expenses related her chess match from his business earning through the increasing next months income. Therefore the loan he is requesting will be dedicated to purchase the more food commodities from his suppliers for raise his store working capital. According his plan, sales of his store will be increased after the raised working capital.

loans.use: To purchase the more food commodities from his suppliers for raise his store working capital

loans.name: 01 Phú Thọ 3 Phú Sơn 2 Thanh Hoa Group

texts.en:
Mrs Tám operates a food stall, selling vegetables. She is requesting a loan to purchase vegetables to resell.

Tám is 50 years old. She is married and has 2 children.
She is the leader of an 8-member group, the 01 Phú Thọ 3- Phú Sơn 2 solidarity group. 
Tám lives with in Thanh Hoa city, an urban town in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2011, Tám joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Tám has successfully repaid 1 loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Tám has been involved in this business for 2 years. The main hardship that Tám faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Tám hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, to buy a motorbike, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables to resell.

loans.name: Luzalyn

texts.en:
Luzalyn is 30 years old and lives in Tacdog, Siquijor, Siquijor.  She is single.
Luzalyn sells freshly caught fish to earn a living. She has been doing this for 13 years and has requested a loan of PHP 5000 to purchase fresh fish from fishermen and display it at the market.
Luzalyn has been a member of Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative for 11 months. In the future, she hopes to sustain and expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase fresh fish from fisherman and display it at the market

loans.name: 030710-Đông Xuân Vi-Hoằng Thanh- Hoang Hoa Group

texts.en:
Mrs Thích works in agriculture, farming poultry and cattle. She is requesting a loan to purchase baby poultry to raise and resell.

Thích is 56 years old. She is married and has 2 children. She is the leader of a 5-member group, the 030710-Đông Xuân Vi-Hoằng Thanh solidarity group. 
She lives and works in Hoang Hoa district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province, with 2 dependents.

In 2010, Thích joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Thích has successfully repaid 2 loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Thích has been involved in this business for 4 years. One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Thích hopes to make enough money to provide for her kids, to maintain a successful business, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase baby poultry to raise and resell.

loans.name: Thou

texts.en: Thou, 31, is married and resides with her husband and two children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia, an area known for quality palm products. Thou sells vegetables, and her husband is a soldier. This couple works so hard every day for income to help cover the family's expenses. Thou is requesting a loan of USD 500 to repair her house. By doing so, her family will be able to generate more income. In the future, she would like to use any additional income to repair her house. This will be her first loan from KREDIT, a longstanding Kiva partner.

loans.use: to repair her house

loans.name: 030702-Đông Xuân Vi-Hoằng Thanh Hoang Hoa Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Liên works in agriculture, farming poultry and cattle. She is requesting a loan to purchase baby poultry to raise to sell in the future.

Liên is 45 years old and she is married with 2 children. She is the leader of a 3-member group, the 030702-Đông Xuân Vi-Hoằng Thanh solidarity group. She lives and works in Hoang Hoa district, a  rural area in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2010, Liên joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Liên has successfully repaid 2 loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Liên has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Liên hopes for her business to do well, to remodel her house, and to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase baby poultry to raise and sell in the future.

loans.name: Chona

texts.en:
Chona is 52 years old and lives in Binoongan, Enrique Villanueva, Siquijor.  She is married with four children. 
Chona is engaged in selling fish to earn a living and has had this business for 14 years. She earns a PHP 24,000 gross income doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of PHP 30,000 to purchase more fish to sell.
Chona has been a member of Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative for 10 months. Chona hopes to grow her business and have more savings for the future.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell

loans.name: Pheoun

texts.en: Pheoun is 39, married and resides with her husband and four children in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia, an area known for quality palm products. Pheoun and her husband buy rice in stock to resell. This couple works very hard every day for income to help cover the family expenses. Pheoun is requesting a loan of USD 1200 to purchase a motorbike to travel to buy rice. By doing so, her family is able to generate more income. In the future, she would like to use any additional income to repair her house. This will be her first loan from KREDIT, a longstanding Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike to travel to buy rice for sale

loans.name: 030704-Đông Xuân Vi-Hoằng Thanh-Hoang Hoa Group

texts.en:
Mrs Phượng works in agriculture, farming poultry and cattle. She is requesting a loan to purchase baby poultry to raise to sell in the future.

Phượng is 40 years old and she is married with 2 children. She is the leader of a 3-member group, the 030704-Đông Xuân Vi-Hoằng Thanh solidarity group. She lives and works in Hoang Hoa district, a  rural area in Thanh Hoa province, with 2 dependents.

In 2010, Phượng joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Phượng has successfully repaid 2 loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Phượng has been involved in this business for 5 years. The main harship that Phượng faces in her business is the lack of capital.

In the future, Phượng hopes to make enough money to provide for her kids, to maintain a successful business, and to be able to buy a new motobike.

loans.use: to purchase baby poultry to raise and sell in the future.

loans.name: Phen

texts.en:
Phen, 31, is married and resides with her husband and two children in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia, an area known for quality palm products. Phen and her husband buy rice in stock to resell. This couple works so hard every day for income to help cover the family expenses. 

Phen is requesting a loan of USD 700 to purchase a motorbike to travel to buy rice. By doing so, her family is able to generate more income. In the future, she would like to use any additional income to repair her house. This will be her first loan from KREDIT, a longstanding Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike to travel to buy rice to resell.

loans.name: Zosima

texts.en: Zosima is 48 years old and lives in Dansalan, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte. She is married with 10 children. To earn a living, Zosima has a fishing business. She earns about PHP 4,000 each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of PHP 7,000 to purchase a fishing net. She has been a member of PMPC for more than 1 year. In the future, Zosima would like to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase a fishing net.

loans.name: Rexie

texts.en:
Rexie is 42 years old and lives in Sandugan, Larena, Siquijor.  She is married with three children. To earn a living, Rexie has a business of selling food. She earns about PHP 1,000 each month doing this type of work. She requested a loan of PHP 7,000 to purchase raw ingredients for her food vending business.

She has been a member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative for one month.  In the future, Rexie would like to create a new menu for her business. She hopes also that her children will be able to finish their studying.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients for her food vending business.

loans.name: Kimsang

texts.en: Kimsang, 38, is married and resides with her husband and two children in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia, an area known for quality palm products. She sells pigs and cows, and her husband is a motor-taxi driver. This couple works so hard every day for income to help cover the family expenses. Kimsang is requesting a loan of USD 500 to purchase more pigs to raise for sale. By doing so, her family will be able to generate more income. In the future, she would like to use any additional income to repair her house. This will be her first loan from KREDIT, a longstanding Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy pigs to raise for sale.

loans.name: Sophal

texts.en: Sophal, 38, is married and resides with her husband and four children in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia, an area known for quality palm products. Sophal is employed at a garment factory and also produces traditional baskets to sell. This couple works so hard every day for income to help cover the family expenses. Sophal is requesting a loan of USD 1,200 to purchase cows and baskets to resell. By doing so, her family is able to generate more income. In the future, she would like to use any additional income to repair her house. This will be her first loan from KREDIT, a longstanding Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy cows and baskets to resell.

loans.name: Levita Gina

texts.en:
Levita Gina has the drive and attitude to succeed. She is 40 years old and happily married to Elmer. The couple was blessed with four children, ages 11,10,6 and 4 respectively. The family resides in the peacful village of Jurisdiccion Amulung, Cagayan. 

According to Levita Gina, they had decided to invest their starting capital of P4,000 in buying scrap materials like used bottles, metals, plastics and old newspapers that they can resell at higher prices.

As of now she aims to diversify her business, so she is asking for a loan of P40,000 to buy more junk products like used bottles, old newspapers, empty cans and metals to resell. This loan will help improve her business.

Levita Gina's faith in God and sacrifices would allow them someday be alleviated from poverty.

loans.use: to buy more junk products like used bottles, old newspapers, empty cans and metals to resell

loans.name: Nelfa

texts.en: Nelfa is 55 years old and lives in Punta Sulong, Baliangao. She is married with six children. Nelfa works in the fish industry and sells fish for a living. She has been doing this for 12 years. She has requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase fish to sell. She has been a member of PMPC for 5 years.

loans.use: To purchase 10 boxes of fish.

loans.name: 030707-Đông Xuân Vi-Hoằng Thanh-Hoang Hoa Group

texts.en:
Mrs Quy works in agriculture, farming poultry and cattle. She is requesting a loan to purchase baby livestock to raise to sell in the future.

Quy is 63 years old and she is married with 4 children. She is the leader of a 3-member group, the 030707-Đông Xuân Vi-Hoằng Thanh solidarity group. She lives and works in Hoang Hoa district, a  rural area in Thanh Hoa province, with no dependents.

In 2010, Quy joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business, and has successfully repaid 2 loans. Quy has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that Quy faces in her business is the lack of capital.

In the future, Quy hopes to maintain a successful business, to be healthy and happy, and to buy land of her own.

loans.use: to purchase baby livestock to raise and to sell in the future.

loans.name: Saream

texts.en: Saream, 44, is married and resides with three children in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia, an area known for quality palm products. Saream produces traditional baskets to sell. She is requesting a loan of USD 500 to purchase a motorbike for the children to commute to work. By doing so, her family is able to generate more income. In the future, she would like to use any additional income to repair her house. This will be her first loan from KREDIT, a longstanding Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike for her children to commute to work.

loans.name: Wilfred

texts.en:
Wilfred is married and blessed with five children, and two of them are in school. He has been operating a van transport business to support his family. He also does dairy farming to earn more income. He has employed one person to help him to manage the business. Wilfred has been able to retain his business because of a good reputation with his customers. 

He is requesting for a loan of 60,000 Kenya shillings to buy a cow.

loans.use: To buy a cow.

loans.name: Elizabeth's Group

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a housewife who stays at home and performs her household duties. She is a very responsible person and performs her tasks very well. Her husband operates a vegetable selling business. His shop is situated in a nearby market where he runs his business. Due to fresh quality vegetables, he makes good sales everyday.

Elizabeth is the mother of 2 daughters. Both of them are young and help her in her daily routine tasks. She has applied for a loan from KIVA partner Asasah for the further expansion of her husband’s vegetable selling business. With the loan investment, he will purchase fresh seasonal vegetables for selling to his clients. He has been operating his business for the past many years, and Elizabeth is hopeful that an investment will help him make more profits from his business.

loans.use: to buy fresh seasonal vegetables for a vegetable selling business.

loans.name: Lawrence

texts.en:
Lawrence is married and blessed with two children whom attend school.  

He describes himself as a hardworking business man. He has run a welding business for the last 21 years, to support his family. 

He has three employees. 

Lawrence expresses gratitude to Faulu Kenya, because it has helped him become more business oriented. 

He has requested a loan of 50,000 Kenyan shillings to buy a welding machine. In the next 5 years, he wants to expand his business.

loans.use: to buy a welding machine.

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis is married and blessed with two school age children. 

For the last five years, he has sold sand to make a living.  He also rents houses to generate more income. 

Francis has been able to retain his business because he has a good reputation with his customers.  

He has employed two people.  Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has been able to access loans to boost his business.  In the next five years, he wants to expand his business. 

Francis has requested a loan of 40,000 Kenyan shillings to buy more sand for resale.

loans.use: to buy more sand for resale.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is married and blessed with three children who are in school. 

She has run a tailoring business for the last four years to support her family. She has stayed in business because of her hard work. In the next five years, she plans to establish a wholesale business. 

Christine has requested a loan of 23,000 Kenyan shillings to buy a sewing machine and to add to her stock of fabric.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine and to add to her stock of fabric.

loans.name: Kimly

texts.en: Kimly, 25, is married and resides with her husband in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia, an area known for quality palm products. Kimly raises pigs and grows rice, and her husband is a mechanic. Kimly is requesting a loan of USD 500 to purchase more pigs to raise for sale. By doing so, her family is able to generate more income. In the future, she would like to use any additional income to repair her house. This will be her first loan from KREDIT, a longstanding Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy more pigs to raise for sale.

loans.name: Shabana's Group

texts.en:
Shabana has applied for a loan from KIVA partner Asasah for her sewing business. With the loan she will buy a new sewing machine, because her current machine is causing problems for her and she is unable to fulfill the client orders on time. She is well experienced in her business and hopeful that by purchasing a new sewing machine she will be able to run her business better and increase her profits.

She is 37 years old and has no child yet. Her husband is a factory worker and works for a low income. Due to her husband's low income, Shabana started her business to financially assist him. She is confident about her business success after the loan investment.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine for her sewing business.

loans.name: Sothea

texts.en:
Sothea is married and resides with her seven children in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia, an area known for quality palm products. 

Sothea sells lotus flowers, vegetables and fruits. 

Sothea is requesting a loan of USD 1,000 to repair her house. This will be her first loan from KREDIT, a longstanding Kiva partner.

loans.use: to repair her house.

loans.name: Pamela

texts.en:
Pamela is married and blessed with three children all of whom attend school. 

She runs a retail shop to support her family and has been in business for the last five years.  She has stayed in business through her hard work and determination. 

Pamela has requested a loan of 80,000 Kenyan shillings to buy sugar, rice and wheat flour for resale. In the next 5 years, she wants to expand her business. Thanks to Faulu Kenya, she has been able to adopt the culture of saving.

loans.use: to buy sugar, rice and wheat flour for resale.

loans.name: Sreypov

texts.en:
Sreypov, 40, is married and resides with her husband in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia, an area known for quality palm products. 

Sreypov’s husband is a construction worker and he also buys used motorbikes to resell. 

Sreypov is requesting a loan of USD 500 to purchase a motorbike to resell. By doing so, her family is able to generate more income. 

In the future, she would like to use any additional income to repair her house. This will be her third loan from KREDIT, a longstanding Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike to resell.

loans.name: Habiba

texts.ru: Хабиба проживает в городе Турсунзаде. Ей 49 лет. Она замужем. У нее трое детей. Хабиба имеет средне – специальное образование, медсестра. По специальности она проработала 23 года. Сейчас она продолжает свою деятельность. Кроме того она занимается скотоводством. Разводит скот у себя дома. Кредит берет для закупа коровы, чтобы увеличить количество скота.
texts.en: Habiba lives in the city of Tursun-zoda.  She is 49 years old, married and has three children.  Habiba has a secondary-specialized education and is a nurse.  She already spent 23 years working in that field and continues her work there.  Besides, Habiba is involved in animal husbandry.  She breeds livestock at home.  She is requesting this loan for the purchase of a cow in order to increase livestock quantity.

loans.use: to purchase a cow

loans.name: Benjamin

texts.en:
Benjamin is married and blessed with two children who are in school. 

He has been using his lorry as part of his transport business.  He has four years of experience.  Benjamin has improved his business because he has learned business management skills, by Faulu Kenya. 

He has requested a loan of 50,000 Kenyan shillings to service the lorry.

loans.use: to service the lorry.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles is a hardworking businessman aged 39. He is married and blessed with four children who are in school. For the last three years, he has been selling clothes to support his family. In the next five years, he plans to manage a wholesale business. 

He has requested a loan of 10,000 Kenya shillings to add stock of clothes for resale. Charles dreams of becoming more financially stable in the future. Thanks to Faulu Kenya, he has been able to save part of his income.

loans.use: To add stock of clothes.

loans.name: Chanthard

texts.en:
Chanthard, 27, is married and resides with her husband in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia, an area known for quality palm products. 

Chanthard is employed at a garment factory, and her husband sells palm products. 

Chanthard is requesting a loan of USD 500 to purchase a motorbike for her husband to take palm products to sell. By doing so, her family is able to generate more income. 

In the future, she would like to use any additional income to repair her house. This will be her first loan from KREDIT, a longstanding Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike for her husband to take palm products to sell.

loans.name: Kholik

texts.ru: Холик 49-летний женатый человек. У него трое детей. По специальности он шафер. Он предоставляет услугу, такси. В этой области 10 лет. Кредит берет для ремонта ходовой части машины и обновления салона.
texts.en: Kholik is 49 year-old married person.  He has three children.  His profession is a driver.  Kholik provides a taxi service and has been in this business for ten years.  He is requesting this loan to repair his car drive train and update the interior.

loans.use: to repair his car drive train and update the interior

loans.name: Geoffrey

texts.en:
Geoffrey is 25 years old, married, and has a five-year-old child. To earn a living, he sells cereals. He has been in the business for three years. He also sells water for extra income. Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has witnessed a lot of growth in his business.

Geoffrey desires to own a wholesale business in five years. He needs 30,000 Kenya shillings (KES) to buy cereals.

loans.use: To buy cereals.

loans.name: Shamsidin

texts.ru: Шамсидин занимается разведением крупнорогатого скота. Этим видом деятельности занимается восемь лет. Кредит берет для закупа телят. Шамсидин женат. Ему 37 лет. У него четверо детей.
texts.en: Shamsidin grows, breeds and sells cattle.  He is 37 years old, married with four children.  Shamsidin has been in this industry for eight years.  He is asking for a loan of $650 to purchase calves.

loans.use: For the purchase of calves

loans.name: Danilo

texts.en:
Danilo is 42 years old, is married, and has one child. He is a farmer in the Philippines, and is willing to do everything just to lift up his family from poor living. He has been experienced in this field for 20 years and earns 28,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) per crop season. According to him, through the income he generated from his business, he was be able to send his child to school.

Right now, Danilo wants to barrow a loan of 20,000 PHP to purchase farm inputs such as fertilizers and seedlings. He hopes that he can get the amount he requested to further grow his farm business.

loans.use: to purchase farm input such as, fertilizers and seedlings

loans.name: Martha

texts.en:
Martha, a 57 year old, is married and has five children. She has been practicing dairy farming for over ten years. The climate of her region has favored her farming. Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has learned how to save her money and access loans, which has helped her to boost her business.

Martha hopes to practice large-scale farming in five years. She needs 20,000 Kenya shillings (KES) to buy animal feeds.

loans.use: To buy animal feed.

loans.name: Rano

texts.ru: Раъно занимается торговлей на рынке, где в основном продает лепешки. Этим видом деятельности она занимается восемь лет. Ей 40 лет. Она замужем. Кредит берет для приобретения муки, масла и молока для последующей выпечки национального вида хлеба (кульча). Кроме того она берет кредит для покупки лепешки.
texts.en: Rano is involved in sales at a market and primarily sells flatbread.  She has been involved in this business for eight years.  Rano is 40 yeas old and married.  She is requesting this loan for the purchase of flour, oil and milk for the next baking of the national bread variety (kulcha).  Besides, she is requesting the loan for the purchase of flatbread.

loans.use: to purchase flour, oil and milk, and flatbread

loans.name: Rosario

texts.en:
Rosario's goal in life is to improve her family's living condition. She is 48 years old and blessed with four children. Two of them already settled for marriage. The others still attend to school. Rosario is married to Celestino, a farmer in their village. Rosario operates a small store in which she sells sardines, coffee, milk, sugar, and other basic kitchen needs. She had been in this business for four years and earns 1,500 Phillipines pesos (PHP) each week. Profits earned are used for allowances and meals, and serve as a revolving capital in the business. 

Rosario's business needs additional products to sell such as canned goods, instant noodles, and beverages to increase her profits. She is now asking for a loan of 35,000 PHP to buy these grocery items. Buying these items would help increase sales capacity. Additional revenue would be saved for emergency purposes.

loans.use: To buy grocery items such as canned goods, instant noodles, and beverages to sell in her store.

loans.name: Aasia's Group

texts.en:
Aasia is 27 years old, married, and has a 3-year-old daughter.

Her husband is a daily wage laborer and she supports him by doing decorative embroidery. She is very skillful and receives a good number of orders every month.

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her business improvement. With the loan she will buy embroidery material in bulk quantity such as beads, threads and embroidery frames that will allow her to make better looking embroidered clothes and increase her profits.

She has been operating her business for many years and is confident that a loan investment will help her to improve her business further as well as her profits.

She is a new loan applicant and very confident about her future success as a result of the loan investment.

loans.use: to buy beads, embroidery frames, thread, etc..

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To service his van.

loans.name: Dilfuza

texts.ru: Дилфуза жительница города Турсунзаде. Возраст, 36 лет. Замужем, имеет троих детей. Она занимается торговлей женских халатов, обуви и пастельного белья. В этой области у нее богатый опыт. Она берет кредит для приобретения махровых халатов, женского нижнего белья и домашних тапочек.
texts.en: Dilfuza is a resident of the city of Tursun-zoda.  She is 36 years old, married and has three children.  She is involved in sales of women's robes, shoes and bedding.  Dilfuza has a rich experience in this field.  She is requesting this loan for the purchase of terrycloth robes, women's undergarments and house slippers.

loans.use: to purchase terrycloth robes, women's undergarments and house slippers

loans.name: Haitgul

texts.ru: Хаитгул жительница района Джиликул. Ей 24 года. Она не замужем. Живет вместе с родителями. Уже восемь лет как она занимается растениеводством. При доме у нее имеется участок земли, где она выращивает овощи и бахчевые культуры. Кредит берет для закупа минеральных удобрений.
texts.en: Haitgul lives in the Jilikul region. She is 24 years old and unmarried. She lives with her parents. For eight year she has been in the business of growing crops. At home she has a piece of land where she grows vegetables and gourds. She is requesting a loan to purchase fertilizer.

loans.use: Purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is a 56-year-old married woman with six children. Her husband is a fisherman.

Gloria is a food vendor. From selling fruits and vegetables, Gloria decided to venture into selling cooked meals. 

She requested this loan to purchase raw ingredients such as pork and chicken meat, vegetables and spices. Gloria hopes for her business to grow more. She hopes to open a restaurant in the future.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients such as pork and chicken meat, vegetables and spices.

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
This is Mary Jane, 40, a resident of Tanza, Cavite City, Philippines. Her husband is Larry, a security guard, and father to her two children. The children are studying in high school and elementary. She, together with her husband and children, manages their own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Mary Jane operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a PHP 5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 350 PHP in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 9,000 loan. She will be using the loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products needed in her business. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Mary Jane hopes her business grows into a mini-grocery and dreams to be able to give her children a good and high-quality education through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Silvestre

texts.en: Silvestre is 44 years old and has been energetically farming in the village where he lives for over 21 years. His farm produces almost 100 cavans of rice per cropping and his net income is PHP 45,000. He expects major changes in his family’s living standards. Therefore, Silvester is requesting a loan of PHP 20,000 from ASKI to buy seedlings, fertilizers and insecticides for his rice field. Silvestre hopes to grow his business and harvest more rice to sell. He appreciates ASKI and KIVA lenders' services and is looking forward to a long term relationship with them.

loans.use: to buy seedlings, fertilizers and insecticides for his rice field

loans.name: Sambath's Group

texts.en:
Sambath is 46-year-old married woman with two children who are still in school. 

Living in a rural area, Sambath raises pigs to feed her family. Also, she runs a small grocery store at the front yard to raise additional income. She has been with this business for almost eight years. 

Sambath leads a group of two female members. This is her first group loan with VisionFund. She is requesting for a loan to buy feed for her pigs. This loan will enable her to grow her pigs to be healthy and fat. 

She also hopes to earn more income from this business to better feed her family and keep her children in school.

loans.use: to buy feed for her pigs.

loans.name: Matlyuba

texts.ru: Матлюба проживает в районе Джиликул. Ей 24 года. Она замужем. У нее двое детей. Ее дети маленькие, а муж находится в России. Сама Матлюба занимается выращиванием овощей для торговли. Кредит берет для закупа минеральных удобрений, чтобы получить хороший урожай.
texts.en: Matlyuba lives in the Jilikul region. She is 24 years old. She is married with two children. Her children are small, but her husband is in Russia. Matlyuba grows vegetables for sale. She is requesting a loan to purchase fertilizer in order to have a good harvest.

loans.use: purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Rica

texts.en:
Rica is 28 years old and lives in Tinago, Siquijor, Siquijor.  She is married and has three children.

Rica has a general store and earns approximately PHP 8,000 a month doing this type of work.  She requested a loan amounting to PHP 15,000 to purchase more stock for her general store.

Rica has been a member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative for 11 months. In the future, Rica hopes to expand and improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase more stock for her general store.

loans.name: Zosima

texts.en:
Zosima is a 41-year-old married woman with four children. Her children are aged between 11 and 23 years old. Zosima's husband works as a farmer and carpenter.

Zosima sells viands to earn a living. She requested this loan to purchase ingredients such as meat and vegetables. Zosima will also pay for her children's school fees. She works hard to support her family and improve their living situation. In the future, Zosima hopes for her children to finish college and to build a bigger house for her family.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients such as meat and vegetables and pay for school fees

loans.name: Estrella

texts.en:
Estrella is a married woman with four children. Estrella is 57 years old, residing at Camanga, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. 

Estrella owns and operates a gardening land, planting and harvesting  a variety of vegetables for sale to earn a living, and she's been 30 years in this business. Each month, she earns 15,000 PHP doing this business. 

She requested a loan of 20,000 PHP to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. Estrella is been a member of GDMPC for almost a year. In the future, Estrella wants to make improvements to her house and enable her children to complete their studies.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise.

loans.name: Jackelyn

texts.en:
Jackelyn is a business oriented person. She uses her skills in hair cutting and coloring as an income source. She operates a small beauty salon in the public market of Don Domingo but her family lives at Tanza, a 20-minute ride to her business. She has been in this business for five years.

She is now asking for a loan of P7,000 to buy scissors, towels, chairs and tables that will improve the services offered in her beauty salon.

She hopes to make her business more profitable.

loans.use: to buy scissors, towels, chairs and tables for her beauty salon

loans.name: Astanakul

texts.ru: Астанакул 59 лет. Он женат. У него шестеро детей. Он занимается посевом пшеницы, кукурузы, картошки и лука. В этой области он 40 лет. Кредит берет для покупки минеральных удобрений.
texts.en: Astanakul is 59 years old. He is married and has six children. He harvests wheat, corn, potatoes and onions. He has been in this line of work for 40 years. He is requesting a loan to purchase fertilizer.

loans.use: purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Getar Muda Group

texts.en:
Faridah is 37 years old and married with three children. All of her children are going to school. Two of them are in the middle school and one in elementary school. She has been selling mobile phone minute refills from her house for seven years. The business has been steady. The income that she gets can help her husband to cover daily basic needs of the family, including school fees. But she needs more capital to have more mobile phone minute refills to resell to create more income. 

In the future, she plans to have her own shop and have more customers. She also might try to find another type of business she can run in addition to the mobile phone minutes sales because she enjoys running her own business.

Other group members plan to use their loans to help their businesses which include a general store and traditional clothing sales.

loans.use: to buy more mobile phone minute refills to resell.

loans.name: Nat's Group

texts.en:
Nat, living in a rural area of Thmor Koul district, is a 58-year-old widowed mother of three children. The oldest child works in the field to help her. The second kid works in Thailand for additional income, and the youngest is still in university. 

She has been farming on her three hectare rice farm for 20 years to earn a living and feed her family. 

Nat leads a group of three female members. This is her first group loan with VisionFund. She is applying for a loan. She will use this loan to buy fertilizer for the rice field and pay for laborers. With this loan, she hopes to increase her crop yield, which will enable her to earn more income to feed her family well and also keep her child in university.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her rice field and pay for laborers.

loans.name: Ma. Agnes

texts.en:
This is Agnes, 41, a resident of Tanza, Cavite City, Philippines. She is married to Oscar, an employee, and a mother of five children. She, together with her husband and children, manage the household while operating a business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.
  
Agnes operates a food stall. In the Philippines, the whole working community and most families only eat home-cooked meals during the evenings when all the family members are at home to take part in the meal. This is not only a usual family tradition but a matter of convenience and frugal living. It is considered a waste of time and money to spend cooking gas and food for only one to two people when buying cooked rice and viands cost less than raw food. 

Agnes' regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 400 PHP in sales every day. To help her continue to operate her business, she is requesting a loan of 17,000 PHP. She will be using the loan to buy more products such as meats, rice, vegetables, condiments, seasonings, and frozen food products. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Agnes dreams of being able to give all her children a good and high quality education through her hard work in her business. She also hopes to have her own restaurant. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients

loans.name: Susan Wanjiku

texts.en: Susan Wanjiku is married and has two children of ages twenty-one and twenty-five. She sells curtains, wedding gowns, and dresses to new and frequent customers at a shopping centre in Nairobi. She has been in this business for fifteen years and has one employee. The business is faced with the problem of the high cost of the rent of the store.S he wants a loan of KES 50,000 to buy two sewing machines. In the next five years, she wants to expand her business. Susan describes herself as patient and determined.

loans.use: to buy two sewing machines.

loans.name: Amada

texts.en:
Amada is a 61-year-old married woman with 9 children. She is a farmer working in Trinidad, Bohol. Amada primarily grows rice crops to sell. Amada earns about 12,000 PHP per month doing this farming. Amada works hard to support her family.

Amada has requested a loan to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs. Amada hopes to have a stable income so she could pay her obligations and provide for her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs.

loans.name: Razia's Group

texts.en:
A talented and caring lady, Razia operates a grocery store at her home to supplement the income for her family. She sells through her store edible items for children like chips and biscuits, and spices, lentils and cooking oil to her community clients. Her talent in dealing and reasonable rates attract clients to her store to buy products.

Her husband operates a local food business. He sells Samosay and Pakoray (a popular food items made with gram flour and filled with spices and potatoes). The taste of his products is very good and he makes good profits every month.

Razia has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the further improvement of her husband’s business. With the loan, he will purchase required ingredients such as gram floor, cooking oil, potatoes and spices in bulk quantity that will allow him to earn better profits from his business. He has been operating his business for past many years and Razia is hopeful about his business success as a result of loan investment.

loans.use: To buy required ingredients for a local food business.

loans.name: Mengchhoeurn's Group

texts.en:
Mengchhoeurn is a 23-year-old mother of two children living in a rural area of Thmor Koul district. Her children are not of school age yet. To make a living for her family, she has been farming on her rice field since she was with her mother, which is now almost 10 years. Also, she catches fish to better feed her family. 

Menchhoeurn leads a group of two female members. This is her first group loan with VisionFund. She is requesting a loan to buy rice seeds for her two-hectare farmland. With this loan, she hopes to increase her crop yield and to earn more income to better feed her family, build on some savings for her family and children to attend school.

loans.use: to buy rice seeds for her rice field.

loans.name: Madelyn

texts.en:
Madelyn is from the village of San Carlos, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 29 years old, and married with one child. 

Madelyn owns and operates a business providing trysikad (pedicab) services in the local community. She has been in her business for over four years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month. 

In 2009, Madelyn joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Madelyn is requesting a loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase a transport vehicle to improve the business. This loan will be her fifth from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase a transport vehicle to improve her business.

location.town: San Carlos, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Analiza

texts.en:
Analiza is 20 years old and lives in Trinidad, Bohol. Analiza manages a rice farm given to her by her parents. She hires a few local farmers to help till her land and grow rice crops. 

Analiza is requesting a loan to purchase seeds and fertilizers and pay for labor. Analiza is saving for her and her baby's future. She hopes to own a bigger farm in the future.

loans.use: to purchase seeds fertilizers and  to pay for labor.

loans.name: Jaime

texts.en: Jaime is from the village of Alicia, Isabela. He is the proud father of six children. Jaime helps to support his family through their family farm. He is married to Angelina who has helped him manage the family farm for 30 years. He is known for being a hardworking and honest person. He would like a loan of PHP 25,000 to buy fertilizers and seedlings for his farm. According to his plan, this investment will increase his income. In addition to helping his children, Jaime dreams of renovating the family home. Even though life is difficult, he enjoys being a farmer and living in Philippines.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seedlings for his farm

loans.name: Veronicah

texts.en:
Veronicah is 26 years old, married and has one child who is four years old.  She sells milk to earn a living. She has been engaged in this business for four years. She also does farming to earn additional income.  

Veronicah is requesting a loan for 5,800 KES, which she will use to buy an energy-saving cooker (jiko).  This jiko uses charcoal and has a thick inner lining that saves energy. 

Through Faulu Kenya, she has gained skills on business management. Veronicah hopes to expand her business for more income generation in the future.

loans.use: to purchase an energy-saving cooker.

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Mary Ann is 43 years old, married, and has five children.  She lives in GMA, Cavite City, Philippines. Her husband is a company driver. Together with her husband, she manages their household while operating the piggery business. At this time, she is working hard to provide income for their everyday expenses.

Mary Ann sells live hogs to meat dealers. Sometimes they have the pigs slaughtered and sold in the market. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns approximately 5,000 PHP in sales every week.

Mary Ann is requesting a loan for 29,000 PHP to help her continue operations of her business She will use the loan to buy feeds and additional hogs. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Mary Ann hopes that her business will continue to be successful. She meets weekly with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and study the word of God. 

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To purchase feeds and additional hogs.

loans.name: Bonifacia

texts.en:
Bonifacia is married and has six children. She has been farming for four years. She primarily grows rice to sell. Bonifacia does her best to support her family.

Bonifacia is requesting a loan to purchase fertilizers and pay for school fees. She hopes to send all her children to college and build a better house.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and pay for school fees.

loans.name: Luningning

texts.en:
Luningning is 42 years old, single, and has three children.  She lives in GMA, Cavite City, Philippines. She manages her household while operating the piggery business. She works hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Luningning sells live hogs to meat dealers. Sometimes she has the pigs slaughtered and sold in the market. She also sells pork barbeque for additional income. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns approximately 3,000 PHP in sales every week.

Luningning is requesting a loan for 8,000 PHP to help her continue operations of her business, She will use the loan to buy feeds and additional hogs. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.
  
Luningning hopes that her business will continue to be successful. She meets weekly with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and study the word of God. 

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to purchase feeds and additional hogs.

loans.name: Fatima's Group

texts.en:
Fatima is 39 years old, married, and has four children who attend school. Her husband lives and works abroad.

Fatima is a very active and supportive woman. She sews clothes for her neighboring clients for a reasonable income every month which helps her pay for her children's school fees.

Fatima is requesting a loan from Asasah, which she will use to expand her sewing business. With the loan, she will buy a new sewing machine that will allow her finishing her orders on time as her current machine is old and inefficient.

Fatima is very experienced in her business and has been operating it for many years. She is confident that she will be successful in increasing her profits after making an investment in her business.

loans.use: to purchase new sewing machine for sewing business

loans.name: Hilario

texts.en:
Hilario is a 40-year-old married man with two children aged 14 and 10. Hilario is engaged in fishing, seaweed farming, and rice farming. His main source of income is fishing. He works hard to provide for his family and send his children to school.

Hilario requested this loan to repair his fishing boat and purchase fishing nets. He hopes to improve his fishing business with this loan.

loans.use: to repair his fishing boat and purchase fishing nets.

loans.name: Gloria's Group

texts.en:
Gloria is married with four adult children. She is 49 years old and lives in Dimaluna, Ozamiz City. Gloria sells ricecake to earn a living and has had this business for two years. She has requested a loan of 6,000 to purchase two sacks of rice to make ricecake.

Gloria has been a member of PMPC for two years. In the future, she hopes to be successful in her chosen business.

Gloria is the leader of a two person group.  Although they borrow as a group, each member of the group has his or her own business.

loans.use: to purchase two sacks of rice to make ricecake.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is 24 years old, married and has two children. She sells second-hand clothes. She has been in this business for two years. Previously, she used to farm. She has managed to improve her business through the financial support from Faulu Kenya.  
Rose hopes to have a fully established business in five years. She needs a loan of 10,900 Kenya shillings to buy a solar lamp for personal use.

loans.use: To buy a solar lamp

loans.name: Galina

texts.en:
Galina is married with a grown son. She lives in Zaporozhye, where she sells women’s clothing such as robes, nightgowns, tank tops, and shorts in one of the local markets called a “Krytyi” (which means "covered"). Galina owns a vending kiosk which helps her minimize rental costs. She has been in this business for about 11 years. 

Currently, Galina has about 35,000 Grivnyas (UAH) worth of merchandise. Her net income amounts to 2,500 to 3,500 Grivnya a month. Galina is seeking a loan of 5,000 Grivnyas to purchase seasonal winter merchandise. She always sorts out good quality items for re-sale in her kiosk. Her merchandise is not the cheapest, but she has a loyal clientele. Galina is hoping the current loan will allow her to maintain an adequate amount of inventory on hand and make additional profits. She is going to use the profits to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase seasonal winter merchandise.

loans.name: Yorn's Group

texts.en:
Yorn is a 43-year-old mother, who is widowed and has three children. None of her three children is in school now. One of her children works for others to gain additional income while her oldest kid got married. She runs a small soup store in the village of Thmor Koul district. To earn regular income to feed her family, she sells soup in the harvest season and sells fish in the dry season. 

Yorn leads a group of three female members. This is her first group loan with VisionFund. She is applying for a loan to buy additional kitchen wares for her soup business. This loan will enable her to have sufficient wares to better serve her customers. She hopes to earn more income from this business, which will help her to build her savings in order to build a bigger house.

loans.use: to buy additional kitchen wares for her food business

loans.name: C 7851 Abakangukiramajyambere Group

texts.en:
Epaphrodite is 44 years old and has three children aged between 4 and 12 years old. He owns an agriculture business which is open from 6am until 3pm every day. He currently employs four people to help him. 

He is the leader of the group (pictured with his hand raised) called "C 7851 Abakangukiramajyambere" in the local language. Epaphrodite has ten years of experience in this work. 

Epaphrodite has requested a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company to expand his business by cultivating more rice for sale. With the profit, he expects to save money for his future and to pay his children's school fees.

loans.use: To expand his agriculture business by cultivating more rice for sale.

loans.name: C 12023 Tuzamurane Group

texts.en:
Baptiste is 44 years old and has six children aged between 6 and 16 years old. He owns an agriculture business which is open from 6am until 1pm every day except the weekend. He currently employs four people to help him. He is the leader of the group (pictured with his hand raised) called "C 1203 Tuzamurane" in the local language. 

Baptiste has four years of experience in this work. He has requested a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to expand his agriculture business by cultivating more rice for sale. With the profit, he expects to save money for his future and to pay his children's school fees.

loans.use: To expand his agriculture business by cultivating more rice for sale.

loans.name: Shahnaz Perveen's Group

texts.en:
Shahnaz has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her clothing sales business. She started this business a few years ago to financially support her husband who paints buildings and houses. Shahnaz is is very confident lady and has a great knowledge about the latest trends and fashions in the clothing industry. With the loan, she will purchase the latest variety of clothes in bulk quantity, which will allow her to fulfill the orders of her clients and increase her profits.

Shahnaz is the mother of 5 children. Due to financial constraints, she could not educate her children. All of them are now doing different kinds of work to financially contribute to the family.

Note: In the picture, the lady who has raised her hand is Shahnaz.

loans.use: to buy the latest variety of clothes for her clothing sales business.

loans.name: Jeneth

texts.en:
Jeneth is a married woman from Trinidad, Bohol. Her husband works as a farmer and mechanic.

Jeneth is a food vendor. She sells cooked meals and local delicacies. Jeneth also helps her husband grow rice crops on their land. She does her best to support her family.

Jeneth has requested a loan to purchase flour, sugar, and farm fertilizers. She hopes for her business to grow bigger.

loans.use: to purchase flour, sugar, and farm fertilizers.

loans.name: Alexander

texts.ru:
Александр женат. Его супругу зовут Елена. У них есть четырехлетний сын. Александр имеет собственный бизнес.
Свой бизнес Александр начал в возрасте 18 лет. Он покупает овощи, фрукты, грецкие орехи  оптом и продает их в розницу.  Александр предприимчивый и трудолюбивый и поэтому его бизнес идет вверх.  Этот бизнес содержит семью.
Александр просит предоставить ему кредит в сумме 20,000 гривен для закупки грецкого ореха. На протяжении всей зимы он закупает грецкие орехи, перерабатывает  и тут же перепродает. Александр получит хорошую прибыль и улучшит благосостояние семьи.
texts.en: Alexander is married.  His wife's name is Yelena, and they have a four-year-old son.  Alexander has his own business, which he started when he was just 18 years old.  He buys vegetables, fruits and walnuts wholesale and sells them retail.  Alexander is an entrepreneurial and hardworking person, and this is why his business is moving up.  This business supports his family.  Alexander is requesting a loan in the sum of 20,000 hryvnia to buy walnuts.  He buys walnuts during winter, processes and resells them right away.  Alexander wants to make a good profit and improve his family's welfare.

loans.use: to purchase walnuts for retail sale

loans.name: Sussy

texts.en:
Sussy is 36 years old, married, and has two children. She does tailoring to earn a living. She also farms to earn additional income. 

Sussy is requesting a loan for 5,800 KES, which she will use to buy an energy-saving cooker for personal use. Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has improved her business and her living standards because she has learned more skills on business management and has easy access to loans. Sussy hopes to grow her business for additional income generation.

loans.use: to purchase an energy-saving cooker.

loans.name: Jessica

texts.en:
30-year-old Jessica is a married woman from Trinidad, Bohol. She has three children aged between 4 and 10 years old. Jessica's husband works as a fisherman and driver.

Jessica runs a sari-sari store business in her town. She sells various items like shampoo, soap, canned goods, and noodles. Jessica also helps sell her husband's catch at the market.

Jessica has requested a loan to buy fishing nets and more items to sell such as canned goods and rice. Jessica hopes to have a stable business in the future.

loans.use: To buy fishing nets and more items to sell such as canned goods and rice.

loans.name: Ayesha's Group

texts.en:
Ayesha is married and has two daughters. They are studying in different classes. Ayesha is very supportive and sells bedsheets along with her husband. Her husband sells bedsheets by taking them on his bicycle while she sells to her local community clients. Both of them work very hard to put three meals on the table for their family every day.

Ayesha has applied for a loan from KIVA partner Asasah for the further expansion of her family business. With this loan she will buy bedsheets in larger quantities that will allow her to sell a wider variety of bedsheets for higher profits. She is very experienced in her business and has been operating it for many years. She is confident that loan investment will help her in further growing her business.

Note: In the picture, the lady who has raised her hand is Ayesha.

loans.use: To buy bedsheets for her bedsheet selling business.

loans.name: Yim

texts.en: Yim, 53, is married and lives with her husband in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia, an area known for quality palm products. Yim and her husband rent microphones and speakers for any ceremony in her village. Yim is requesting a loan of $800 USD to purchase a motorbike for her children to use to commute to work. By doing so, her family is able to generate more income. In the future, she would like to use any additional income to repair her house. This will be her first loan from KREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for her children to commute to work.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 41 years old and a married woman with two children. She and her husband are both farmers. They grow rice crops and vegetables to sell to their community. Jocelyn works hard to improve their income. She hopes to send her children to college and make improvements to their house.

Jocelyn has requested this loan to purchase seeds, fertilizers, and other farm inputs. Jocelyn is hopeful that this loan will help improve their business.

loans.use: To purchase seeds, fertilizers, and other farm inputs.

loans.name: Jimmy

texts.en:
Jimmy is a thirty-one-year-old man living in Masindi, Uganda. He deals in textiles. He started with 500,000 Uganda shillings (UGX), which he saved from his salary, and he now has 2,000,000 UGX as his working capital. Price fluctuations, taxes, and transport costs hinder his business. 

Jimmy wants a loan to buy clothes to resell. His dream is to educate his children and build a permanent house. His business dream is to diversify and expand into new markets.

loans.use: To buy clothes to resell.

loans.name: Yelena

texts.ru:
Елена решила воспользоваться кредитом для закупки сезонной мужской одежды – теплых свитеров и курток. Увеличив ассортимент, она сможет привлечь больше клиентов и соответственно получить больше прибыль. 
Предыдущий кредит помог Елене закупить дополнительный качественный товар. Торговля была хорошей. Елена смогла получить прибыль и помочь своим престарелым родителям, а также дочери.
Елена любит свой бизнес и старается развивать его дальше.
texts.en: Yelena decided to use this loan to purchase men's seasonal clothing, such as warm sweaters and jackets.  Having expanded merchandise selection would enable her to attract more customers and, thus, make a larger profit.  The previous loan helped Yelena to purchase additional quality merchandise.  Her sales were good.  Yelena was able to make a profit and help her elderly parents and also her daughter.  Yelena loves her business and tries to develop it further.

loans.use: to purchase warm sweaters and jackets

loans.name: Sophy

texts.en:
Sophy, 35, resides in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia, an area known for quality palm products. He provides driving training services.

Sophy is requesting a loan of 700 U.S. Dollars (USD) to purchase a car to expand his driving training services. By doing so, his family will be able to generate more income. In the future, he would like to use any additional income to repair his house. This will be his first loan from KREDIT, a longstanding Kiva partner.

loans.use: To purchase a car to expand his business.

loans.name: Julita

texts.en:
43-year-old Julita is a married woman from Trinidad, Bohol. She has had a sari-sari store business for five years. Julita sells items like shampoo, bread, and soft drinks to the people in her community. She earns 5000 Philippines pesos (PHP) each month.

Julita is requesting a loan to buy more items to sell such as soft drinks, shampoo, soap, and rice. Julita plans to expand her store and save more for emergencies.

loans.use: To buy more items to sell such as soft drinks, shampoo, soap, and rice.

loans.name: Salim

texts.en:
Salim a 42-year-old married man with four children living in Masindi, Uganda. He acquired a loan and bought a motorcycle, which he uses to earn income. 

Salim wants a loan to repair his motorcycle. High fuel prices, seasonal weather, and stringent traffic rules are his major challenges. He desires to educate his children and buy land to grow crops.

loans.use: To repair his motorcycle.

loans.name: Umoja B Nyambindo Group

texts.en:
Yovani is wants a loan to buy hardware materials to resell. He lives in Masindi, Uganda. He is age 69 and married with four children, and the responsibility to look after the family rests on him. He dreams of buying a grinding mill so as to diversify his income sources.

Yovani is a member of the above mentioned group. Out of 13 members, only 8 took loans and the rest had to guarantee them as per the group's policy.

loans.use: To buy hardware materials for resale.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes is a 62-year-old woman from Trinidad, Bohol. She is engaged in farming. Lourdes primarily grows rice crops to sell. She also started a small sari-sari store business at her house. She sells various items like biscuits, coffee, and soap. Lourdes works hard to improve her earnings.

Lourdes has requested this loan to purchase fertilizers and more items to sell such as canned goods and noodles. Lourdes hopes to succeed in all her ventures.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and more items to sell such as canned goods and noodles.

loans.name: Sreyem

texts.en:
Sreyem is 21 years old and married. She lives in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia, an area known for quality palm products. Sreyem and her husband sell wooden furniture. 

Sreyem is requesting her first loan from KREDIT for $1,200, which she will use to purchase more wood to produce wooden furniture to sell.  With the loan, her family is able to generate more income. In the future, she would like to use any additional income to repair her house.

loans.use: to purchase more wood to produce wooden furniture

loans.name: Habib

texts.en: Habib operates a restaurant and carpentry business in Masindi-Uganda. He is aged 51 and married with four children. Fluctuating prices due to the current inflation is his major challenge and his dream is a hotel in the city. He desires to educate his children, and expand business. Habib wants a loan to buy food for his restaurant.

loans.use: to buy food for his restaurant.

loans.name: Veth

texts.en: Veth, 63, is married and resides with her husband in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia, an area known for quality palm products. Veth and her husband are farmers. They also sell natural medicine when they are available from the rice field. Veth is requesting a loan of USD 800 to repair her house. By doing so, her family is able to generate more income. This will be her first loan from KREDIT, a longstanding Kiva partner.

loans.use: to repair her house.

loans.name: Teofila

texts.en:
Teofila is a married woman from Trinidad, Bohol. She is engaged in farming. Teofila primarily grows rice crops to sell. She requested this loan to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs. Teofila hopes to achieve an abundant harvest. She hopes to have a stable income to help sustain her children's education.

In the future, Teofila hopes to own a bigger farm.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs.

loans.name: Lan's Group

texts.en:
Lan was born in 1979. She lives in Xom Mit village, Co Loa commune, Dong Anh district. She is a farmer. Her husband is a driver. He has an income of about 4,000,000 VND per month. 

Not only does Mrs.Lan grow rice, but she also sells breakfast. She has had this job for five years. Besides, she is cooking for a school near her house. She has a monthly income of about 3,000,000 VND. 

She has participated in SEDA since 2007. The last time she borrowed 6,322,000 VND and repaid this loan punctually. This is the sixth time she is borrowing from SEDA. 

She is the leader of a five-member group loan in SEDA. In this loan cycle she would like to borrow 7,630,000 VND to buy foodstuffs for cooking breakfast to sell.

About the other borrowers in her group:

Thanh is 28 years old. She is a tailor. She wants to borrow 6,322,000 VND to buy cloth.
Xuan is 33 years old. She has three children. She wants to borrow 6,322,000 VND for a small business.
Phuc is 43 years old. She has three children. She wants to borrow 6,758,000 VND to breed pigs.
Duyen is 29 years old. She has two children. She wants to borrow 6,758,000 VND for a small business.

loans.use: to buy foodstuffs to cook breakfast to sell.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is 54 years old and has 3 children, aged between 26 and 31. She sells vegetables at a market where she has been for fifteen years.
 
Christine would like a loan to buy more vegetables to sell at the market. Any profits from the business will be used to buy a home for her family.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Marie Josee

texts.en:
Marie Josee is 30 years old and has two children, aged 2 and 3. She is married to a house builder. 

She sells used clothes in a store she has run for ten years. Marie Josee would like a loan in order to buy a larger variety of clothing to sell. 

Any profits from the business will be used to save for the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more used clothes to sell.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma wants a loan to buy chickens for her poultry farm. She lives in Masindi, Uganda. She is married and charged with the responsibility of taking care of her four children. She has been raising chickens for six months. 

She desires to educate her children and buy a car for transport. Her dream is to move her business to a permanent location.

loans.use: to buy chickens.

loans.name: Hanan

texts.en: Hanan is a 22-year-old young woman. She is married with two sons. Her husband is a Palestinian National Authority employee with a decent salary.To improve his income he works part time as a taxi driver. Hanan wants to help her husband pay for repairs on his taxi such as painting and changing the engine, but she does not have enough money. Therefore she needs a loan of $1,500 from FATEN. When Hanan gets the loan, her husband will be able to make the necessary repairs on his taxi. This will increase the taxi efficiency and enable her husband to work extra hours to increase his income and improve the family's living conditions. Hanan is a conservative woman so her husband, Shawqi, is photographed next to his taxi.

loans.use: To pay for vehicle repairs

loans.name: Eustaquia

texts.en:
Eustaquia has been engaged in her rice farming business for twenty-five years. She earns about P30,000 every harvest. She has also been selling fruit and vegetables for almost one year and earns P200 daily. She is willing to work hard every single day to lift her family out of poverty. She is married to a farmer who helps her to manage their farm. 

According to her, through the income generated from her business she has been able to support her family's needs. She is requesting a loan of P 35,000 to purchase seeds and fertilizers to sustain her rice production.
