She loves doing sewing work and has learned this art from her mother. Due to the good quality of her work, she receives a good number of orders every month.
She is very supportive in nature and has applied for a loan from KIVA partner, Asasah, for the further improvement of her husband’s shoe-making business because he has a large order to fulfill.
With the loan investment, he will purchase shoe laces, leather and other raw materials in larger quantity.  That will allow him to complete the larger orders on time and earn him more profits.
He is very experienced and has been operating the business for the past many years. Robina is hopeful that an investment will be a productive one for him and will increase his profits.
Robina is a new loan applicant and hopes that it will be a profitable experience for her.

loans.use: to buy raw material such as shoe laces, leather for shoe making business

loans.name: Consuelo

texts.en:
This is Consuelo, 51, a resident of Pasay City, Philippines. She is a married to her husband Melchor, a vendor, and they have three children. She, together with her husband and children, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.

Consuelo operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries, and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a 5 pesos worth of cooking oil, or an egg. Celia earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 300 Philippines pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a loan of 13,000 PHP. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries, and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.

Consuelo dreams to be able to give all her children a good future through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Poninate

texts.en:
Poninate is 22 years old and lives in the town of Kasese in the Fort Portal region of Uganda. She is married and has two children who are both currently in school. For the past year, Poninate has been working hard to manage her restaurant, which prepares hot Ugandan meals for local customers.

To help expand her business, Poninate has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan shillings (UGX) from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more ingredients and a sauce pan, and will help Poninate to generate greater profits and pay for her children's school fees. Poninate hopes that in the future she will be able to buy a plot of land and build a house. 

Poninate is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training. The ELA program has increased Poninate's future prospects by helping her to learn how to save money.

loans.use: To purchase more ingredients and a sauce pan.

loans.name: Sida Group

texts.fr:
Mme Pauline représente le groupe SIDA. Elle est mariée et mère de 02 enfants. Le plus âgé a 8ans et le moins âgé a 4ans. Un va à l’école et elle a 2 personnes en charge.

Elle vend des céréales depuis 3ans. Mme s’approvisionne dans les villages environnants (TITA, TOE, LEO).Ses clients sont les hommes et les femmes.

Elle veut s’acheter un sac de maïs; un sac de petit mil; un demi sac d’arachide; et un sac d’haricot.

Elle aide son mari dans les charges familiales et économise un peu. Ses ambitions sont d’agrandir son commerce (prendre des tonnes de céréales) et d’améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Pauline represents the SIDA group. She is married and has 2 children, aged 8 and 4. One of the children attends school. Pauline is responsible for 2 people.

She has been selling grains for the past 3 years. She obtains her supplies in nearby villages such as Tita, Toe and Leo. Her customers are both men and women. She would like to buy one sack of corn, one sack of pearl millet, a half sack of groundnuts and one sack of beans. Pauline helps her husband with the family's expenses, and puts some money aside. Her goals are to expand her business (to buy grains by the ton) and to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy one sack of corn, one sack of pearl millet, a half sack of groundnuts and one sack of beans.

loans.name: Chenda's Group

texts.en:
Chenda, 41, is married and has six children, one of whom is married while the other five are still in school. To earn a living and feed her family, she started raising ducks eight years ago in a rural area of Thmor Koul district selling duck eggs and ducks. 

Chenda leads a group of three female members. She and one of her group members have been with VisionFund for four cycles while the other is just with VisionFund for this cycle. The loans from VisionFund helps Chenda earn regular income to better feed her family. She is now requesting a fifth loan to buy feed for her ducks. With this loan, she hopes to feed her ducks to be healthy and fat and also earn more income to support, keep her five children in school, and build up some savings to build a better house.

loans.use: To buy feed for her ducks.

loans.name: Mousa

texts.en: Mousa is a 27-year-old young man. He is married with one daughter. He has a car accessories store where he sells items such as car oil and filters. He wants to purchase more of these accessories but does not have enough money so he needs a loan of $2,000 from FATEN. When Mousa gets the loan, he will be able to purchase car accessories for his store. He will increase his inventory and increase his income, enabling him to provide better living conditions for his family. Mousa is photographed in the picture.

loans.use: To purchase car accessories for his store.

loans.name: Oñondivepa Group

texts.es:
Este comité es de la ciudad de Asunción, está integrado por 14 mujeres, todas ellas muy trabajadoras y luchadoras.Actualmente se encuentran en su décimo segundo ciclo, donde podemos destacar el sentido de responsabilidad y los deseos de progresar que tienen de cada una de las integrantes en la asistencia en la capacitaciones. Desean que sus hijos no pasen por los mismos problemas económicos y educativos por las que ellas tuvieron que atravesar, es por ello que se esfuerzan el doble.
Una de las integrantes es Mercedez, quien se dedica a la venta de todo tipo de prendas. Ella dice que por medio de este trabajo ella ha podido mantener a su familia y salir adelante. Ella tiene buena clientela, por lo que le esta yendo muy bien en su negocio. Ella quiere seguir invirtiendo en el, para seguir creciendo cada día más y mas.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de prendas de verano, con lo cual podrá abastecerse y tener más variedad de prendas con las que podrá cumplir con sus clientes.
texts.en:
This group is from the city of Asunción. It is made up of 14 women who are all very hard-working. They are currently in their twelfth cycle; their sense of responsibility and desire to get ahead every day is tangible. They don't want their children to have the same economic and educational problems that they have had to deal with, so they are working even harder.
One of the group members is Mercedez. She sells all types of articles of clothing. She says that this work has allowed her to support her family and get ahead. She has a good customer base, so her business is going very well for her. She wants to continue to invest in her business, in order to keep growing more and more every day.
She is requesting this loan for the purchase of summer clothing. This will allow her to stock up and have a greater variety of clothing in order to satisfy her customers.

loans.use: to buy summer clothing for the next sale.

loans.name: Nino

texts.en:
Nino is 40 years old. She lives in the village Sartichala with her family: her husband George, a 17-year-old daughter, and a 16-year-old son. Both children go to school. 

Nino works in a local school as a teacher. Along with her main job, she is actively involved in the family's dairy farm. In particular, they have two milk cows. Nino produces cheese and sells monthly on average 60 kg of the product in Tbilisi (capital city of the country).

Nino requested credit for purchasing high-quality natural food for her cows for the winter months. It will increase yield of milk and allow the family to produce and sell more dairy products. The family will use the increased income for their well-being.

loans.use: To purchase feed for cows for winter months.

loans.name: Bahodur

texts.ru: Баходур примерный семьянин женат, отец четверых детей. Его старший сын помогает ему в бизнесе. А занимается он постройкой решеток для виноградников из арматуры. Бизнес востребованы, так как на селе у всех есть виноградные поля. Он хочет создать хорошие условия для дальнейшего обучения своих детей в ВУЗах. Место деятельности у него дома, никаких расходов по транспортировке у него нет. Он хочет получить займ для закупа сырья и просит займ в размере 1000$ США. Он надеется на милосердие добрых людей и благодарен вам всем за помощь.
texts.en: Bahodur is an exemplary family man, who is married and is father of four children.  His oldest son helps him with the business.  Bahodur is involved in constructing barred fence fixtures for vineyards.  This business is in demand because their village has vineyards.  Bahodur wants to create good conditions for his children's continued education in universities.  His place of business is at home, and, thus, he has no transportation expenses.  He wants to obtain a loan in the sum of $1000 for the purchase of raw materials.  Bahodur relies on the mercy of kind people and is grateful to all of you for the help.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials

loans.name: Namakhele Group

texts.en:
Edwin is the facilitator of the Namakhele group. Edwin and his group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Edwin takes care of one child at home. He joined One Acre Fund to access fertilizer and hybrid seed. In the recent 2011 season, Edwin had a good maize yield harvesting six bags on ½ acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Edwin was only able to harvest three bags of maize on ½ acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Edwin and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from his maize sales, Edwin will educate his children, build a house and invest in livestock rearing.

In 2012, the members of Namakhele group will each plant maize plots between ½ and 1 acre of land.

In the photograph above, Edwin is pictured with his group members and the field officer appears on the far left.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Jihad

texts.en: Jihad is a 38-year-old Lebanese married man living with his wife and three children; two of them are still attending school. He is the main income source of the family. He has owned a computer shop since 2009 in which he sells computer games, computers, and related accessories. Today, he’s requesting to borrow $1500 from kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase additional computers to satisfy his customer’s demands. In that way, he will be able to increase his business sales and therefore his income. In the future, he plans to expand his business and start networking work.

loans.use: To purchase additional computers.

loans.name: Chea's Group

texts.en:
Chea, 62, is married and has six children, four of whom work in Thailand while the other two work on the farm. She started farming on her rice field 10 years ago to earn a living. To better feed her big family, she also raises pigs to gain additional income.

Chea leads a group of two members in a rural area of Thmor Koul district. She has been with VisionFund for one cycle and completely repaid the loan with VisionFund while her membership is just with VisionFund for this cycle. Now she is applying for her second loan. She will use this loan to buy a water pump for her rice field. This loan will enable her to increase her crop yield and she hopes to earn more income to better feed her family and set aside some savings for future expenses.

loans.use: To buy a water pump for her rice field.

loans.name: Barnokhon

texts.ru: Барнохон трудолюбивая женщина. Она замужем, мать четверых детей. Она на протяжении многих лет занимается бизнесом, вначале она продавала молочную продукцию и постепенно поменяла вид бизнеса на продажу сезонных товаров. В настоящее время она продает промышленные товары. Для расширения бизнеса она хочет получить займ в размере 6000 сомони чтобы пополнить свой оборот зимними товарами. Она надеется получить займ и получить больше дохода. Заранее благодарна всем за предоставленную помощь.
texts.en: Barnokhon is a hardworking woman. She is married and the mother of four children. She has been working for many years; at first she sold dairy products and gradually transitioned to selling seasonal goods. She currently sells industrial goods. To expand her business she is requesting a loan of 6000 somoni to add to her collection of winter clothes. She hopes to receive this loan and earn more income. She thanks you in advance for extending your help.

loans.use: purchase winter clothing

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has four children, all of whom are in school. 

Alice has a business of a retail shop. She has been in this business for over 10 years, and she works 7 days out of every week. Alice sells her products from home, by means of retail. 

Alice has requested a loan of 800,000 Ugandan shillings (UGX) from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bags of charcoal, cartons of salt, and boxes of soap. The main business challenge(s) for Alice include transportation and increasing prices of commodities in Uganda. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to own a fully stocked shop selling on wholesale and to own a delivery van. Alice lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity but doesn't have access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more bags of sugar, cartons of salt, and boxes of soap.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase bulk rice and flour.

loans.name: Hussein

texts.en:
Hussein is a 44-year-old Lebanese married man. He lives with his wife and three school-aged children. 

Hussein has been working in selling computers for the past 20 years, and owned his shop since 2009. He has one full-time employee helping him with the work. Today, he’s asking to borrow $1500 from kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase more computers and products such as cables, keyboards, and many other items to sell in order to serve a wider range of clientele. In the future, he hopes to further enlarge his business.

loans.use: To purchase more computers and products such as cables, keyboards, and many other items.

loans.name: Primicia Group

texts.es:
El comité “ Primicia” se formó gracias al deseo de superación del nivel de vida de sus miembros. Ellas son mujeres muy trabajadoras y emprendedoras, con muchas ganas de salir adelante y de progresar en la vida. Su principal motivación ha sido darles a sus hijos un futuro mejor.
Zunilda es una de esas mujeres, ella tiene un local de venta de bebidas, gracias a este negocio y sumado a su amabilidad y buen trato a los clientes, ella puede ayudar a su familia. Comenta que ya se ha formado una clientela que siempre va hasta su local y que gracias a eso ella puede seguir creciendo y agrandar su negocio. Una de sus metas es seguir creciendo y tener un local bien amplio y surtido.
Ella solicita la ayuda de la fundación y de kiva, para la compra de cervezas, sidras y vino, con lo cual podrá abastecerse, pues se acercan las fiestas y quiere estar preparada.
texts.en:
The Primicia Communal Bank was formed, thanks to its members’ wish to overcome their conditions of life. They are very hardworking and enterprising women who want to get ahead and succeed in life. Their principal motivation has been to provide a better future for their children.

Zunilda is one of those women. She has a shop selling drinks. Thanks to this business and her friendliness and good customer service, she has been able to help her family. She says that the clientele who always come to her place has been growing and thanks to that, she is able to continue  expanding her business. One of her goals is to grow even further and to have a spacious and well stocked shop. She is requesting a loan from the Fundación and Kiva in order to buy beer, cider and wine, with which she will be able to supply her shop since the holiday season is fast approaching and she wants to be prepared

loans.use: to buy beer, cider and wine.

loans.name: Manal

texts.en: Manal is a 34-year-old young woman. She is married with three sons and three daughters; her husband is a Palestinian National Authority employee with a decent salary. Manal wants to make some repairs to her house such as painting, changing tiles and changing windows and doors but she hasn't enough money so she needs a loan of $1,000 from FATEN. When Manal gets the loan, she will be able to pay for repairing her house and her family will live in better conditions. Manal is a conservative woman, so her husband Alaa' is photographed instead.

loans.use: To pay for house repairs.

loans.name: Abdumachid

texts.ru: Абдумачид примерный семьянин, отец двоих детей. Жена домохозяйка. Он предоставляет услуги такси на протяжении семи лет. Этот бизнес востребован и он имеет хорошие доходы. Вся полученная выручка уходит на содержание семьи. Он хочет дать своим детям хорошее образование. С наступлением зимы следует отремонтировать машину и подготовить к зиме. Он запрашивает займ для ремонта и покупки шин для автомашины. Он надеется на вашу помощь и поддержку. Спасибо.
texts.en: Abdumachid is an exemplary family man, the father of two children. His wife is a homemaker. He has provided taxi service for the past seven years. His services are in high demand and he earns a good income. All of his proceeds go to providing for his family. He would like to provide a good education for his children. With the upcoming winter, he should repair and winterize his car. He is requesting a loan for repairs and purchasing tires for his car. He looks forward to your help and support. Thank you.

loans.use: buy tires and repair his car

loans.name: Abdou  Ibrahima Salam

texts.fr:
Monsieur Abdou Salam  est un jeune cordonnier âgé de 24 ans. Il est célibataire et exerce sa profession depuis plus de 5 ans. Il a ouvert un petit atelier pas loin de chez lui.
Avec le prêt il envisage d’acheter de la matière première : colle, tapis afin de confectionner le maximum de chaussures pour la fête de la Tabaski qui se trouve être l’une des plus grande fête musulmane.
Abdou vit avec ses parents  et avec les revenus de son commerce il aide beaucoup dans la gestion  de la maison.
texts.en:
Mr. Abdou Salam, 24 years old, is a young shoemaker. He is unmarried and has been practicing his trade for over five years. He has opened a small workshop not far from his home. 

With this loan, he envisions buying some raw materials: glue and cloth. This is for making the biggest number of shoes for the Tabaski holiday, which is one of the biggest Muslim festivals. 

Abdou lives with his parents, and with the revenues from his business, he is helping a lot with maintaining the household.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for making shoes

loans.name: San Pedro Y Pablo Group

texts.es:
“San Pedro y San Pablo” fue denominado el comité  formado por amigas y vecinas de una de las ciudades de Carapeguá, actualmente se encuentran en el 7° ciclo con 17 integrantes. Es un grupo de señoras muy responsables y trabajadoras, ellas se dedican diversas actividades, pero también realizan trabajos en conjunto para fomentar su trabajo en equipo.
Mercedes comenta que en su negocio de venta de joyas le va muy bien, puesto que ya tiene una variedad clientela, tanto de hombres como mujeres, siempre levanta muchos pedidos. Lo que la ayuda a progresar es la simpatía y la buena onda con la que atiende a sus cientes, y sumado a ello la cómoda manera de pago que ella les ofrece.
Ella solicita la ayuda de la fundación y de kiva, para la compra de anillos, pulseras, cadenas y demás tipos de joyas, lo cual la ayudara a abastecerse y cumplir con la demanda de sus clientes.
texts.en:
The communal bank named “San Pedro y San Pablo” was formed by friends and neighbors from one of the cities of Carapeguá.  Now this group is in its 7th loan cycle with 17 members.  This is a group of very responsible and hardworking women.  They have a variety of businesses, but they also carry out joint activities to develop their teamwork.  

Mercedes comments than her business selling jewelry is going very well since she now has a varied clientele, as many men as women, and she always has a lot of orders.  What helps her to progress is the kindness and warmth with which she attends to her customers, and in addition to this, the easy payment terms that she offers.

She requests the assistance of the Fundacion and of Kiva, so that she can buy rings, bracelets, chains, and other types of jewelry.  This will help her to stock her business and have products available to meet the demands of her customers.

loans.use: to buy rings, bracelets, chains and other types of jewelry

loans.name: Rasta's Group

texts.en:
Rasta's group is comprised of six hard working women. Rasta is 22 years old and lives in the town of Kamwenge in the Fort Portal region of Uganda. She is married and has three children, two of whom are currently in school. For the past year, Rasta has been working hard to manage her small shop, which sells dried foods. 

To help expand her business, Rasta has requested a loan of 350,000 Ugandan Shillings (UGX) from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more food like maize and beans for resale, and will help Rasta to generate greater profits and pay for her children's school fees. Rasta hopes that in the future she will be able to buy a plot of land and build a house.

Rasta is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training. The ELA program has increased Rasta's future prospects by helping her to learn how to save money.

loans.use: To purchase more food like maize and beans for resale.

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en:
Mahmoud is a 37 years old, married, and has one child. He opened his own car smithy garage in 1998. 

Mahmoud is requesting a loan for $1,000 from Ameen s.a.l, which he will use to purchase an iron welding machine.  This purchase will enable him to enhance his repair services. In the future, he plans to expand his business operation and hire new employees to work with him. His income is needed to help support his family.

loans.use: to purchase an iron welding machine.

loans.name: Tres Fronteras Group

texts.es:
Tres fronteras lleva el nombre D. este comité D. la ciudad D. Luque, las 21 integrantes son vecinas y amigas D. esa ciudad, todas ellas se unieron con la esperanza D. un mejor porvenir para sus hijos y familiares. Ellas son mujeres jefas D. familia que quieren luchar para salir adelante.
La sra. Berna, es una D. las miembros, trabaja en artesanía D. karanday (un tipo D. madera),está acompañada hace 11 años con el señor Lucilo quien trabaja como vendedor D. las artesanía en karanday que ella hace, tienen cuatro  hijos menores que todavía van a la escuela. Ella comenta que juntos se ayudan para poder salir adelante.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra D. karanday, el cual es el instrumento esencial para la elaboración D. sus artesanías.
texts.en:
This group from the city of Luque is known as "Tres Fronteras". There are 21 members who are neighbors and friends. They all meet with the hope of a better future for their children and families. The women are heads of their families that want to fight in order to get ahead. 

One of the members, Berna, is a craftswoman, working with karanday (a type of wood). She has been with her partner Lucilo for 11 years, who works selling the products that she makes. They have 4 young children who are in school. She tells us that together they are helping themselves to move forward.

She asks for a loan to buy karanday, which is the main material that she needs to make her crafts.

loans.use: to buy wood to make artisan crafts.

loans.name: Zakaria

texts.en:
Zakaria is from the village of Tskarostavi, East Georgia. He is 37 years old, married and lives with his wife Lela and two sons, 12 and 7 years old. Both children go to school.

Zakaria and Lela earn a living through family farming. They have two milk cows and sell milk and yogurt in the local market. In addition, they grow maize on family owned one hectare of land. Last year they harvested four tons of maize and plan to sell it in winter when the price of the maize goes up. 

This year, Zakaria decided to sow wheat instead of maize. According to his estimations, wheat will give him a higher profit. He requested credit for covering land cultivation expenses as well as purchasing the wheat to sow. 

Zakaria and Lela hope that they will have a good harvest and will get more profit to use to improve the family living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase wheat and to cover land cultivation expenses

loans.name: Rimah

texts.en: Rimah is a 27-year-old young woman. She is married with three sons; her husband works in selling secondhand home appliances. He earns a low income but wants to expand by purchasing more home appliances to resell thus increasing the family income. Rimah wants to help her husband expand his business by taking a loan of $1,000 from FATEN. When Rimah gets the loan, her husband will be able to purchase more secondhand home appliances, thus increasing his inventory and sales. This will increase his income and improve the family's living conditions. Rimah is photographed in the picture.

loans.use: To purchase more home appliances vintage to resell.

loans.name: Nueva Esperanza Group

texts.es:
19 mujeres de la ciudad de Luque se han unido con muchas ganas de progresar y de salir adelante. Estas mujeres son muy trabajadoras luchadoras y muy sacrificadas. Día a día se esfuerzan por poner el pan en sus mesas y de que a sus hijos no les falte nada. Comentan que ellas hacen reuniones periódicas para poder tratar temas del grupo y problemas que ellas puedan tener.
La sra. Mirtha esta acompañada hace 10 años con el señor Gustavo quien trabaja como plomero por cuenta propia, tienen dos  hijos quienes son muy pequeños aun. La señora comenta que ella por medio de su esfuerzo y su trabajo ayuda a su marido con los gastos de la casa, para que todo sea más llevadero.
Mirtha retiró el crédito para la compra de variados tipo de lencería, lo cual le será de mucha ayuda. Ella tiene como meta abrir en su casa una mercería y así ir mejorando el ingreso de su familia y satisfacer sus principales necesidades.
texts.en:
19 women in the city of Luque have joined forces out of the desire to progress and get ahead. These women are hardworking and willing to make sacrifices.  Day after day they work hard to put bread on their tables and to make sure that their children don't lack anything. They say that at their periodic meetings they talk about different topics with the group and problems that they might have. 

Mirtha has been with Gustavo, who is self-employed as a plumber, for 10 years and they have 2 young children. She comments that because of her hard work she is able to help her husband with their household expenses which makes them more tolerable. 

Mirtha took out a loan to buy various types of lingerie, which will help her a lot. Her goal is to open a shop in her home and continue increasing her family's income so that she can satisfy their basic needs.

loans.use: to buy lingerie to sell.

loans.name: Azar

texts.en: Azar is a 40-year-old man who is engaged in farming and has 6 years experience in this field. He is an IDP (internally displaced person). Azar is married and has two children. He usually raises and sells seasonal fruits and vegetables in the local, central bazaar. His monthly income is 230 AZN. His wife actively helps him to run the business and this is the only financial income in their family. Azar applied for 1500 AZN to purchase seeds and fertilizer. He has a good client history and this will be his second loan.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Inuka Shg Group

texts.en:
Violet is the facilitator of the Inuka SHG group. Violet and her group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Violet and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

Violet takes care of four children at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to grow enough to secure food for her family and to receive One Acre's best prices. In the recent 2011 season, Violet had an excellent maize yield harvesting 21 bags on one acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Violet was only able to harvest three bags of maize on one acre of land.

With income from her maize sales, Violet will invest in livestock rearing and buy more land as savings for future use.

In 2012, the members of Inuka SHG group will each plant maize plots between ½ and 1 acre of land.

The photograph shows Violet with her group members. Standing on the far left is the field officer.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Khalil

texts.en:
Khalil is 43 years old, married, and has two children, one of whom attends school.  He works as a home painter and has been doing so for the past 20 years. In 2000, he started his own business taking private projects. 

Khalil is requesting a loan for $1200 from  Ameen s.a.l., which he will use to purchase additional painting products and supplies for his business. In the future, he plans to work on bigger projects.

loans.use: to purchase additional painting products and supplies.

loans.name: Awatef

texts.en:
Awatef is a 50-year-old married woman, mother of six children. Awatef has been working selling men's, women's and children's shoes since 2006. She is a hard worker, and she insists on providing the best living for her family.

Just like every mother, Awatef cares a lot for her children's comfort, and that's why she supports and develops her business as much as she can, in order to keep on developing.

Awatef has been an Al Majmoua-KIva partner borrower for two cycles. Her experience with Al Majmoua was very effective and encouraging. Today Awatef is requesting a loan from Kiva, in order to buy a new winter collection  of shoes, attracting enough to new customers and old ones.

She hopes to open another branch to expand her working zone and to improve her income.

loans.use: To buy a range of new winter shoes.

loans.name: Alexandre

texts.pt:
Nasceu no Distrito de Boane, Província de Maputo, Sul de Moçambique, casado e pai de 16  filhos dos quais 2 ainda frequentam a Escola. Fez a 2ª classe e parou por falta de condições financeiras pela parte dos pais. Vive na casa propria com a sua familia e sustenta mais 2 netos que vivem com ele. 

É pedreiro ha mais de 30 anos e tem um rendimento de cerca de 9.000.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancaria(BIM).
Nunca teve emprestimos noutros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku atravez de uma amigo que tambem é cliente desta instituição. Este é o seu segundo emprestimo na Hluvuku no valor de 20.000.00mt, com qual pretende comprar material de construção da sua casa(areia, pranchas, cimento, pedra, ferro e outros).O primeiro emprestimo foi de: 25.000.00mt para habitação.
Compromete se a pagar devidamente e no futuro pretende terminar a obra da sua casa e mobiliar, para tal tenciona solicitar mais emprestimos a Hluvuku.
texts.en:
Alexandre was born in the District of Boane, Province of Maputo, South of Mozambique, is married and the father of 16 children, 2 of which still attend school. He completed 2nd grade and didn’t continue with his education due to his parents’ lack of financial means.

He has been a stonemason for more than 30 years and has a monthly income of around 9,000.00 meticals (MZN) which he uses on household expenditures and saves in his bank account (BIM).

He has never has loans with other banks and he came to know Hluvuku through a friend who is also a client of this institution. This is his second loan with Hluvuku for the amount of 20,000.00 MZN, with which he intends to purchase construction materials for his house (sand, planks, cement, stone, iron and others). His first loan was for: 25,000.00 MZN also for his home.

Alexandre commits to paying off his loan and in future intends to complete the build of his house and to furnish it, for which he will solicit further loans from Hluvuku.

loans.use: purchase construction materials for his house (sand, planks, cement, stone, iron and others)

loans.name: Joyce Muthanje

texts.en:
Joyce Muthanje, 28 years old, is single and has a two-year-old son. She does printing and photocopying for the city council, government offices, and new customers at Mwingi town in Thika. She has been in this business for the last two years.The business is faced with problems when the electricity goes off, as it is solely dependent on this.

Joyce wants a loan of Kes.15,000 to buy printing ink, colours and stationery. In the future, Joyce wants to run a stationery shop. She describes herself as patient, mature and committed.

loans.use: To buy printing ink, colours and stationery

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase two calves

loans.name: Mujeres Trabajadoras Group

texts.es:
El presente comité se formó gracias al contacto D. una D. las miembros, quien se informó acerca del programa D. la fundación e invito y organizo a sus amigas para formar parte del programa Comité D. Mujeres Emprendedoras, actualmente se encuentran trabajando muy a gusto y quieren seguir con el proyecto.
La Sra. Gladys, es una D. las miembro trabaja en la costura y es confesionista, está casada hace 8 años con  el señor Jorge quien trabaja como Protocolista en el poder judicial. Tienen dos hijos, y nos comenta ella que esos niños son la razón D. ser D. ella y D. su marido, pues es por ellos que trabajan día y noche para darles un futuro mejor al que ellos tuvieron.
La señora Gladys solicita el crédito para la compra D. elementos para su trabajo D. la costura, como ser telas e hijos, cierres, botones y demás. Ella tiene como objetivo ampliar su taller D. costura dentro D. su casa con lo cual podrá seguir creciendo.
texts.en:
This committee was formed thanks to one of the members who became aware of the foundation's programs and organized her friends and invited them to be part of the Comite D. Mujeres Emprendedoras [Committee of Enterprising Women]. They are working well and want to continue with their project.

Gladys works as a seamstress. She has been married to Jorge, a Registrar for the justice department, for 8 years. They have 2 children and she says that the children are their reason for being. For them they work day and night, so they can give them a better future than what they had. 

Gladys asks for a loan to buy materials for her sewing work like fabrics, thread, zippers, buttons and other things. Her goal is to increase the size of her workshop insiD. her home so that she can keep growing.

loans.use: to buy fabric, thread, zippers, buttons and other things.

loans.name: Riverside Shg Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Riverside SHG Group in Western Kenya! Agnes is the facilitator of the Riverside SHG group. This  group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Agnes takes care of three children at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Agnes had a very good maize yield, harvesting 18 bags on 1 acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Agnes was only able to harvest 3 bags of maize on 1 acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Agnes and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from maize sales, Agnes plans to save for future use and in livestock rearing.

In 2012, the members of Riverside SHG group will each plant  between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

The photograph shows Agnes with her group members.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en: Ahmad is a 28-year-old man who breeds cattle. He has been engaged in this business for the past 4 years. He is an IDP (internally displaced person) and lives with wife in Bilasuvar IDP Settlement. He usually buys small calves, raises them and resells them in 5-6 months at a more profitable price. Ahmad sells cattle for meat which is a very profitable business because meat is very popular in Azerbaijan and locals use it in everyday cuisine. His monthly income is 200 AZN. His wife helps him to run the business. Cattle breeding brings stable income to Ahmad’s family; it is the family's only income source. He needs additional capital to purchase more cattle to increase sales and improve the living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Zeina

texts.en:
Zeina is 21 years old and single.  She lives with her parents and sibling. She has been working as a private teacher since 2006. She welcomes students at her house. She also started working in a local school almost one year ago. 

Zeina is requesting a loan for $1,100 from Ameen s.a.l., which she will use to prepare a special teaching room in her house and add equipment  such as tables and walls in order to be able to receive more students. She will also purchase diverse educational tools.

loans.use: to prepare a special teaching room in her house and purchase equipment and diverse educational tools.

loans.name: Nueva Esperanza Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Nueva Esperanza, está formado por 16 integrantes quienes invierten en diferentes actividades de producción la ayuda que les brinda la fundación, se encuentran en el segundo ciclo del Programa Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras y les gustaría poder ir creciendo por medio de la ayuda de la fundación.
La Sra Lucina, tiene 33 años, es comerciante, tiene una pequeña despensa bien surtida. Tiene 2 hijos uno tiene 13 años y la otra 10 años ambos están estudiando aun en la escuela. Ella nos comenta que sus hijos son su razón de ser y que ellos siempre la motivan a seguir luchando. Cuenta que tiene muchas ventas y pedidos por lo que solicita el crédito para poder cumplir con los pedidos.
La Sra Lucina pide el crédito para la compra de maíz, fideos, azúcar, harina, y demás productos, los cuales le servirán para abastecerse y cumplir con la demanda de sus clientes.
texts.en:
This group, called Nueva Esperanza, is made up of 16 members who invest the support they get from the foundation into their various lines of work. They are in their second lending cycle with the program Comite de Mujeres Emprendedoras and they want to keep growing with the help of the foundation. 

Lucina, 33, is a merchant with a small but well-stocked store. She has two children, ages 13 and 10, who are in school. She tells us that her children are her reason for being and that they motivate her to keep fighting. She has many sales orders, which is why she asks for a loan to be able to complete those orders.

Lucina asks for a loan to buy corn, pasta, sugar, flour and other products to stock her store and meet her customers' demand.

loans.use: to buy corn, pasta, sugar, flour and other products.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase cattle.

loans.name: Nueva Estrella Group

texts.es:
El comité "Nueva Estrella" se originó a traves de promociones  que se realizó en el barrio de las miembros. Los objetivos de cada de una de ellas son trabajar en equipo, fomentar el espíritu solidario y llegar al nivel máximo del programa. Gracias al programa comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras las señoras valoran la importancia de un crédito y la oportunidad  de estar en un comité, conocer gente nueva, cosechar amistades, tener fuente de trabajo digno y mejorar la educación de sus hijos mediante las capacitaciones brindada por el programa.
Claudia, tiene una peluquería, en la que trabaja todos los días. Comenta que recibe todos los días a muchos clientes y clientes, por lo que nos comenta que le va muy bien. Ella gracias a su amabilidad y a su buen trabajo atrae a las personas para que puedan volver siempre, es por ello que ya tiene una buena clientela. En su afán de seguir dando lo mejor a sus clientes, ella solicita el crédito para la compra de tintes, esmalte para uñas, spray, gel, y demás insumos necesarios para su profesión. Ella al igual que las demás están muy agradecidas a la fundación por la oportunidad que esta le da.
texts.en:
The committee Nueva Estrella began as a result of ads in the members' neighborhood. All of them want to work in a team, encourage a spirit of unity and reach the highest level of the program. Thanks to the trainings given as part of the Enterprising Women program, the women understand the importance of a loan and the opportunity to be part of a group, meet people, make friends, have dignified work and improve their children's education.

Claudia has a beauty shop where she works every day. She has customers every day and tells us that it's going very well. Thanks to her friendliness and hard work she attracts customers who keep coming back. Because of that she already has a good clientele. In her eagerness to continue giving her customers the best, she asks for a loan to buy hair dyes, nail polish, hair spray, gel and other materials that she needs for her work. Along with the others, she is very thankful to the foundation for the opportunity that this gives her.

loans.use: to buy hair dyes, nail polish, hair spray, gel and other products.

loans.name: Joseph Musili

texts.en:
Joseph is married and he and his wife have a four-year-old daughter. He runs a restaurant that sells food and snacks to local residents in Thika town. Joseph has one employee and has been in this business for one year. His business faces the problem of electricity going off frequently within the area. 

Joseph wants a loan of KES 20,000 to buy more wheat flour and cooking fat. In the next five years, he wants to run another restaurant in Mwingi town in Thika. Joseph describes himself as a talkative man who shares ideas with others.

loans.use: to buy more wheat flour and cooking fat.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase cattle.

loans.name: Sharif

texts.en: Sharif is a 28-year-old Lebanese man, who is engaged and lives with his parents and two siblings. He has owned a computer and networking shop since 2006. He really likes his occupation. With his requested loan of $600 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l, he will be able to renovate his shop in order to attract more customers. Each day he looks for things to add that are of value so that his business can become more attractive, and he is sure that this Kiva loan will help him fulfill his business needs.

loans.use: to renovate his shop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase building materials to cover his roof

loans.name: Kuña Guapa Del Barrio La Mil Vivienda Group

texts.es:
El comité "Kuña Guapa del Barrio Mil Vivienda" es de la ciudad de San Ignacio, esta integrado por 11 mujeres que tienen por objetivo que cada una pueda trabajar y así fomentar el espíritu emprendedor para llegar a realizarse como personas y como trabajadoras.
Mirna es una de las miembros, ella es una señora muy trabajadora y sacrificada, quien nos comenta que todo los días ella empieza a trabajar desde muy tempranas horas, para poder elaborar alimentos frescos, los cuales luego pone a la venta. Dice que se han hecho de muy buena fama sus comidas en el barrio y alrededores, por lo que ha ganado más clientes.
Ella quiere estar siempre abastecida de lo principal que necesita para hacer sus alimentos y es por ello que solicita el crédito, para la compra de carnes, embutidos, verduras, panificados y demás, los cuales son esenciales para ella.
texts.en:
The committee named “Kuña Guapa del Barrio Mil Vivienda” is from the city of San Ignacio. This group consists of 11 women whose goal is for each one of them to be able to work. By promoting the entrepreneurial spirit, they will be able to develop as individuals and as workers.

Mirna is one of the members. She is a hardworking and self-sacrificing woman. Mirna says that she begins her work every day in the early morning hours, preparing fresh food that she will sell later in the day. She says that her meals have earned a good reputation in her neighborhood and in the surrounding areas. As a result, she has gained more customers.

Mirna always wants to be stocked with what she needs for preparing meals. Therefore, she is requesting a loan to buy meats, sausages, vegetables, baked goods, and other items that are essential to her.

loans.use: to buy meats, sausages, vegetables, baked goods, and other items.

loans.name: Progressive B Group

texts.en:
Paul is the facilitator of the Progressive B group. Paul and his group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Paul and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

Paul takes care of four children at home. He joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seed and to secure enough food for his family. In the recent 2011 season, Paul had an excellent maize yield harvesting five bags on ½ acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Paul was only able to harvest two bags of maize on ½ acre of land.

With income from his maize sales, Paul will educate his children and save for his business and livestock rearing in the future.

In 2012, the members of Progressive B group will each plant maize plots between ½ and 1 acre of land.

The photograph shows Paul with his group members with the field officer on the far left.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Kaundia

texts.en: Kaunda is 36 years old, married, and has five children who range in age from one year to fifteen years old. He has transported his customers using a motorcycle in the town of Thika for the last four years. His business is faced with the challenge of the high cost of fuel. He wants a loan of KES 40,000 to buy goats for selling as a form of starting a new business. In the next five years, he sees himself transporting passengers using many more motorcycle and having employees to help him. Kaunda is innovative, creative, and a business-oriented man.

loans.use: To  venture into another new business of selling goats hence wants to buy goats.

loans.name: Nelson

texts.en:
Nelson is a 31-year-old business man who lives in Juba. He is married and has four children between the ages of 1 and 13.  Two of them go to school. 

Nelson runs a mixed retail store, and he has been in the business for 11 years. He has no employees. Nelson heard about Finance Sudan through fellow clients and outreach and promotion done by the loan officers. He is taking a loan of SDG 3,000 to purchase more maize flour, wool, paper bags, and many other things. Nelson has no other source of income than his general store.

In 5 years time, Nelson hopes to increase the size of his business. His major challenges include competitors in the market with the same type of general store, which leads to a low income rate.

loans.use: to purchase more maize flour, wool, paper bags, and other things.

loans.name: Avila Group

texts.fr:
Mme MARIAMA est la représentante du groupe AVILA. Elle est mariée  et mère de 08 enfants. Le plus âgé a 21ans et le moins âgé a 03ans.07 vont à l’école. Elle a 11 personnes en charge.

Elle est Tisserant  depuis 21ans. Elle s’approvisionne à  naabis yaar en ville .Ses clients sont les voisins.

Elle veut  s’acheter  20 roulots de fils.

 Avec ses bénéfices, elle veut renforcer son activité. Elle ambitionne aider son mari à payer la scolarité de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Mariama is the representative of the AVILA group. She is married and mother to eight children. The eldest is 21 and the youngest 3 years old. Seven go to school. She has 11 people under her care.

She has been a weaver for 21 years. She gets her supplies at the naabis yaar [street market] in town. Her clients are her neighbors.

She wants to buy 20 rolls of thread.

With her profits, she wants to strengthen her business. Her goal is to help her husband to pay for her children's schooling.

loans.use: to buy 20 rolls of thread

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Khakosi C Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Khakosi C Group in Western Kenya! Miriam is the facilitator of the Khakosi C group. This group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Miriam takes care of nine children at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Miriam had an excellent maize yield harvesting 20 bags on one acre of land. Before joining One Ace Fund, Miriam was only able to harvest six bags of maize on one acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Miriam and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from her maize sales, Miriam will educate her children and pay back loans.

In 2012, the members of Khakosi C group will each plant between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

The photograph shows Miriam with her group members.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Apollonga Atieno

texts.en: Apollongo Atieno is 53 years old, married, and has five children who range in age from 15 to 26. She runs a metal shop where she has sold windows, doors, and gates to new and frequent customers for the last ten years. She has one employee. The business faces the problem of fluctuations in the prices of metals. She wants a loan of KES 80,000 to buy materials for welding. In the future, Apollongo wants to be a supplier of welding materials. She describes herself as patient and ambitious.

loans.use: to buy more materials for welding.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a computer

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase lambs and one calf.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase a new tailoring machine.

loans.name: Scoria's Group

texts.en:
Scoria's group is comprised of three hard-working women. Scoria is 21 years old and lives in the town of Kamwenge in the Fort Portal region of Uganda. She is married and has four children with three of them currently in school. For the past two years, Scoria has been working hard to manage her small stand, which sells fresh fruit. 

To help expand her business, Scoria has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more fruit to sell and will help Scoria to generate greater profits and pay for her children's school fees. Scoria hopes that in the future she will be able to buy a plot of land and build a house. 

Scoria is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training. The ELA program has increased Scoria's future prospects by helping her to learn how to budget and save money.

loans.use: to purchase more fruit to sell.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John  is a 38-year-old businessman who lives in Juba. He is married and has five children between the ages of 17 and 5.  Two of them go to school. 

John runs a clothing store business, and he has been in the business for 10 years. He has no employees. John heard about Finance Sudan through the outreach and promotion done by the loan officers. He is taking a loan of 2,000 SDG to purchase more women's and men's clothing.  John has no other source of income in addition to this business. 

In five years' time, John would like to expand the business size by bringing more items that are not in his shop at the moment.  His major challenge includes the competitors and it’s a seasonal business.

John says that he is happy for Finance Sudan’s support and he hopes God will bring peace to Sudan so that it can continue helping them.

loans.use: to purchase more women's and men's clothing.

loans.name: William Kipkoech

texts.en: William is a 49-year-old married man. He has two children aged 15 and 24. He describes himself as strict, courageous and kind. He operates a livestock sales where he sells cows, sheep and goats. He has been involved in this business for 10 years. His business is located Kakamega town. He describes his biggest business challenge to be that sometimes the marketplace is closed. He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy a cow. His business goal is to expand his business and add another outlet in Nandi shopping centre within 5 years.

loans.use: To buy a cow.

loans.name: 29 De Setiembre Group

texts.es:
El comité “29 de Setiembre” se formó con la unión de varias vecinas de la ciudad de Mariano Roque Alonso.  Todas las integrantes del comité desarrollan actividades independientes, pero también actividades en conjunto que fomentan su compañerismo.  Las integrantes formaron un grupo muy unido, trabajador y emprendedor.
La Señora Myrian es una de las integrantes del comité, ella tiene una familia muy unidad con 1 hija y su marido, quien es empleado. Nos comenta que ella se dedica a la venta de prendas para damas, con lo cual ayuda a su marido con los gastos de la casa y con la manutención de su hija. Dice que gracias al tiempo que lleva en esto, ha podido formarse una clientela bien definida que siempre le hace pedidos.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de prendas para damas, como ser polleras, pantalones, jeans y demás, lo cual la ayudará a surtirse y tener más variedad que ofrecer a sus clientas.
texts.en:
The September 29th Committee was formed as a result of several neighbors from the city of Mariano Roque Alonso joining together. All of the committee members have developed independent businesses, but they also participate in activities together as a group in order to strengthen their camaraderie. The members have formed a group that is united, hardworking, and enterprising.

Sra. Mirian is one of the committee members. Her family consists of her daughter and her husband who is employed. She says that she sells women’s clothing, which helps her husband with the household expenses and supporting their daughter. Mirian says thanks to the time she invests in her work, she has been able to establish a good customer base who always place orders.

She is requesting a loan to buy clothes for women such as skirts, trousers, jeans, and other items. This will help restock her inventory so that she can offer more variety to her customers.

loans.use: to buy women's clothing for eventual resale.

loans.name: Sileva Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Sileva Group in Western Kenya! Lenah is the facilitator of the Sileva group. This  group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Lenah  takes care of seven children at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Lenah had an excellent maize yield harvesting 14 bags on 1 acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Lenah was only able to harvest 6 bags of maize on 1 acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Lenah  and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from maize sales, Lenah will educate her children, ensure food security and invest in livestock rearing.

In 2012, the members of Sileva group will each plant  between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

The photograph shows 6 people; 4 women and 2 men.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase food products for her store.

loans.name: Phiona

texts.en:
Phiona is 22 years old and lives in the town of Kamwenge in the Fort Portal region of Uganda. For the past two years, Phiona has been working hard to manage her small business which sells fresh produce. 

To help expand her business, Phiona has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more food items for resale, and will help Phiona to generate greater profits and improve her family's welfare. Phiona hopes that in the future she will be able to continue expanding her business. 

Phiona is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training. The ELA program has increased Phiona's future prospects by helping her to learn how to manage money.

loans.use: to purchase more food items for resale.

loans.name: Apayi

texts.en:
Apayi is 28 years old and married with four children between the ages of 2 and 10 years old. Three of them are in school. She has a business selling avocados in Yei, south Sudan. She has been running this business for two years and she has no other source of income.

Apayi requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase avocados to sell. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her pay the school fees for her children.

loans.use: to purchase avocados to sell

loans.name: Philister

texts.en: Philister is a single woman. She describes herself to be trustworthy. She operates a cereals store where she sells maize, beans, etc. She has been involved in this business for two years. Her business is located in Kakamega town. She describes her biggest business challenge to be the increased price of goods. She will use the KES 15,000 loan to buy bags of maize and beans. Her business goal is to buy a canter (a light duty commercial vehicle made by Misubishi) for transport services within five years.

loans.use: To buy bags of maize and beans

loans.name: Piga Sévérin

texts.fr:
Mr  PIGA SEVERIN est marié et n’a pas d’enfant. Il s’occupe de quelques enfants dont un va  à l’école. Il a 05 personnes en charge.

Mr est  gérant d’une boutique d’appareils radio et électronique de véhicules  depuis 15ans. Il s’approvisionne au  NIGERIA (pays voisin). Ses clients sont les femmes, les hommes et les jeunes.

Il veut  s’acheter  40 appareils électroniques de voiture.

Mr  utilise ses bénéfices pour  agrandir sa boutique. Il  ambitionne  épargner et assurer la scolarité de l’enfant dont il a la charge.
texts.en:
Piga Severin is married and the father of one. His son is two years old, and he also supports a child who is at school. In total Piga Severin supports five people.

For 15 years, he has managed a shop which sells vehicle radios and electronics. He purchases his stock in the neighbouring country of Nigeria. His customers are women, men and young people.

He wants to buy 40 car electronics accessories.

Piga Severin uses his profits to expand his business. He also wants to save money to pay for the schooling of the child he supports.

loans.use: to buy 40 car electronics accessories.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
El Sr. Juan tiene 35 años de edad, esta acompañado con la Sra. Gladys de 28 años de edad, juntos tienen un hijo de 7 años, el cual es la razón de ser de ellos.
Don Juan tiene un taller en el cual se dedica a la reparación de partes eléctricas de automóviles. Hace mas de 20 años que se dedica a este trabajo, por lo que experiencia tiene. Anteriormente era empleado de una empresa, pero con el correr del tiempo pudo ir juntando para su pequeño capital con el cual se independizo y pudo salir adelante. Juan actualmente ya cuenta con su propio taller empleando a 2 jóvenes que están aprendiendo con él ese oficio. Además de eso manifiesta que su esposa también lo ayuda mucho con los gastos.
Juan solicita el crédito para la compra de repuestos ya que cuenta con muy buena demanda y desea ir a ampliando su clientela y por ende su trabajo y sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Juan, 35, is partnered with Gladys, 28, and together they have a 7 year-old son who is their reason for living.  Juan has a workshop where he repairs the electrical parts of automobiles.  He has been doing this kind of work for more than 20 years, and so he has quite a bit of experience.  Before, he worked as an employee in a company, but over time he gathered together a small amount of capital which he used to become independent, so that he could get ahead.  Now Juan has his own workshop and employs 2 young people who are learning this trade from him.  In addition, he states that his wife also helps a lot with the expenses.  

Juan is requesting a loan to buy spare parts since there is strong demand for his business, and he wants to expand his customer base and thereby increase his income.

loans.use: to buy spare parts to later sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Feryal

texts.en: Feryal is a 28-year-old Lebanese married woman who lives with her husband and one school-aged child. She has been working as a hairdresser and beautician from her home since 2006. She is much endowed at her work and has her loyal customers. As for her husband, he has been working as a salesman in a local company for the past seven years to supplement the family’s income. Today, she is asking to borrow $1,500 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to buy a variety of cosmetics and hairdressing supplies so that she can comply with the demands of her customers. In the future, she plans to open her own beauty center.

loans.use: to buy a variety of cosmetics and hairdressing supplies

loans.name: Linet

texts.en:
Linet is married and has two children. She operates a butcher shop where she sells meat. She has been involved in this business for two years. Her business is located Kakamega town. 

Linet is requesting a loan for  20,000 KES, which she will use to buy a cow. She describes her biggest business challenges to be the increased price of cows and inadequate cows for slaughtering. Her business goal is to run a mini supermarket within five years.

loans.use: to purchase a cow for slaughter.

loans.name: Oscar

texts.es:
El Sr. Oscar tiene 43 años de edad, esta casado con la Sra. Claudia de 35 años, tuvieron la bendición de tener un hijo que actualmente tiene 15 años.

Don Oscar cuenta con un local donde alquila películas y todo tipo de discos. Se dedica a esto hace 8 años, antes de emprender esa actividad estuvo con su esposa trabajando en el exterior y de ese trabajo que tenia pudieron ahorrar para su pequeño capital y emprender el comercio que actualmente tiene. El comenta que su esposa siempre ha sido un gran apoyo para el, y que gracias a ella también han podido salir adelante. El motos de ellos es su hijo, por quien luchan diariamente.

Oscar Solicitó el crédito para la compra de mas películas ya que cuenta con muy buena demanda con sus servicios de alquileres y anhela ir ampliando su comercio para brindarle la mejor atención a sus clientes.-
texts.en:
Sr. Oscar is 43 years old and married to Sra. Claudia, age 35.  He is blessed to have a son who is currently 15 years old.  

Oscar has a shop where he rents out movies and all types of discs.  He has been in business for eight years.  Before starting this business, he and his wife worked abroad.  Through their work, they were able to save up a small amount of capital in order to establish the business they currently have.  Oscar says that his wife has always been a great help to him.  Thanks to her, they have been able to get ahead.  They are motivated by their son, for whom they strive on a daily basis.  

Oscar is requesting a loan to buy more movies.  There is already great demand for rental services, so he wants to expand his business in order to better serve his customers.

loans.use: to buy movies for rent.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel is a 38 year old business man, who lives in Juba. He is married and has 4 children in between the ages of 15 and 3.  2 of them go to school. 

Samuel runs a mixed food store business, and he has been in the business for 15 years. He has no employees. Samuel heard about Finance Sudan through the outreach and promotion done by the loans officers. He is taking a loan of 3000 to purchase more rice, sugar, cooking oil and washing soap. In addition to this business, Samuel has no other source of income. 

In 5 years time, Samuel would like to increase the business size and build a shop. His major challenge includes the competitors in the marketplace and the issue of thieves only. Samuel says that he is happy for finance Sudan’s support and that he hopes they should continue helping the entrepreneurs.

loans.use: to purchase more rice, sugar, cooking oil and washing soap.

loans.name: Mapera A Group

texts.en:
Patrick is the facilitator of the Mapera A group. His group joined Kiva partner One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.
Patrick takes care of seven children at home. He joined One Acre Fund in order to grow enough food to ensure food security for his family and to improve his harvest. In the recent 2011 season, Patrick had a very good maize yield harvesting 14 bags on 1 acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Patrick was only able to harvest 3 bags of maize on 1 acre of land.
With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Patrick and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit, and insurance.
With income from maize sales, Patrick will educate his children and save for future use. In 2012, the members of Mapera A group will each plant maize plots between half and 1 acre of land.
The photograph shows the members of the group.

loans.use: to source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay the university fees for his two sons.

loans.name: Gulniso

texts.ru: Гулнисо умная и честная женщина. Она замужем и на воспитании имеет троих детей. Она старается обеспечить своих детей и ради будущих своих детей работает усердно. Она занимается продажей продукты питания. На протяжении двух лет она в этом бизнесе и трудится расширить его день за днем. Гулнисо хотела бы получить займ для покупки нового ассортимента продукта с целью пополнения оборотного капитала. Она заранее благодарна вам за вашу помощь и милосердие.
texts.en:
Gulniso is a wise and honest woman. She's married and takes care of her three children. All her work is aimed at providing her children with the best possible future. 
She sells foodstuffs and for the past two years she has worked day and night to expand her business. Gulniso is asking for a loan in order to purchase a new assortment of food supplies and increase her working capital. She thanks you ahead of time for your kindness and charity.

loans.use: to purchase additional food supplies and expand her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to make homemade jams and pickles to sell.

loans.name: Grace Kisau

texts.en:
Grace is a 36 year old married woman. She has 4 children, ages ranging from 6 years to 17 years. She describes herself to be social and talkative. 

Grace operates a retail store where she sells maize flour, bananas, sugar, etc. She has been involved in this business for 5 years. Her business is located in Thika town. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate funds to add stock of maize flour, sugar, etc. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy wheat flour. Her business goal is to be a wholesaler within 5 years.

loans.use: to add maize flour.

loans.name: Raghida

texts.en:
Raghida is a 31-year-old Lebanese married woman living with her husband and two children, who are still attending school. She has been working in producing homemade food for the past seven years. She works upon customer’s demands. As for the heavy costs of life, Raghida joins forces with her husband in order to cover at least the mandatory expenses. 

Today, Raghida is asking to borrow $800 from Kiva partner, Ameen s.a.l, to pay her children’s educationA. school fees. In the future, she plans to open her own restaurant and hopes to be able to generate good profits in order to better support her family.

loans.use: to pay her children’s educational school fees.

loans.name: Jackline's Group

texts.en:
Jackline's group is comprised of four hard working women. Jackline is 18 years old and lives in the town of Kachwamba in the Fort Portal region of Uganda. For the past two years, Jackline has been working hard to manage her small restaurant, which sells Ugandan fast food to local customers. 

To help expand her business, Jackline has requested a loan of 400,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more wheat flour and another frying pan, and will help Jackline to generate greater profits and improve her family's well-being. Jackline hopes that, in the future, she will be able to buy a plot of land and build a house. 

Jackline is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training. The ELA program has increased Jackline's future prospects by helping her to learn how to save and budget money.

loans.use: to purchase more wheat flour and another frying pan.

loans.name: Lucy Esi

texts.en:
Lucy Esi is a single parent and has I child. Lucy has been selling provisions, saucepans and bowls for the past 2 years at Kwahinkrom.  She uses her income to provide for her child. 

Lucy will use her loan to purchase more provisions and saucepans.  Lucy hopes to use the profits she makes to educate her child.

loans.use: to purchase more provisions and saucepans.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is 24 years old, married, and has one child.  She sells food in a stall in Yei, South Sudan, which she has been doing for six years.

Christine is requesting a loan from BRAC South Sudan, which she will use to purchase sugar and cassava to sell. The extra income from this loan will help her to build a concrete house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase sugar and cassava to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizer for seasonal fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Amale

texts.en:
Amale is a 43-year-old Lebanese divorced woman, living with one parent. She has owned a clothing store since 2004. She sells only women’s and children’s clothes. 

With her requested loan of $1,500 from Kiva partner, Ameen s.a.l, she will be able to diversify her merchandise selection and purchase new clothes from different brands and trends. She notes that selling good quality clothes will help her attract more customers, and so augment her sales and her income. 
In the future, she plans to expand her business and target a wider clientele.

loans.use: diversify her merchandise selection and purchase new clothes.

loans.name: Alexander

texts.en:
Alexander is 38 years-old and married with one child. His wife is a housekeeper. 

Alexander manages his two hectares of rice field in their village. He is happy that he has maintained his farming business for ten years. Alexander wishes to maintain his business and increase it with the area he plants.  

Alexander practices farming and is able to finance his farm by borrowing from traders. However, he knows that traders have high interest rates. He has no choice because he needs to maintain his business and gain income for his family. Alexander wants to lessen his costs, so he prefers to ask for a loan from Kiva partner ASKI in the amount of P35,000 in order to buy needed farm materials.  He plans to buy seeds, fertilizers and pay farming labor costs.

Alexander will ensure that he will gain a higher income so that he will maintain the business and invest in his agricultural land.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers and pay for farming labor cost.

loans.name: Rose Mutuo

texts.en:
Rose is a 36-year-old married woman. She has four children whose ages range from 10 years to 16 years. She describes herself to be talkative and she likes sharing ideas with others. 

She operates a retail store where she sells maize and wheat flour, beans, sugar, etc.  She has been involved in this business for six years. Her business is located in Thika town. 

She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate funds to add stock of maize flour, sugar, etc. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy wheat flour and maize. 

Her business goal is to be a wholesaler within five years.

loans.use: to add stock of wheat flour and maize.

loans.name: Aba

texts.en:
Aba is a widow with five dependents. Aba sells salted fish and other food items at Kwahinkrom. She has done this for thirty years. She is responsible for paying her children’s school fees.
 
She will use her loan to purchase more salted fish and other food items.  With the new profit, she plans to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy salted fish and other food items.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy bags of rice.

loans.name: Gila

texts.en: Gila is a 56 year-old woman who has been raising cattle and cows for the last four years. She is an IDP (internally displaced person) and lives with her husband and five children in Bilasuvar IDP Settlement. Gila’s income consists of milk and homemade yoghurt sales as well as from cattle sales for meat purposes.  Her monthly income is 300 AZN. Meat and milk sales bring her a stable income and are in high demand among Azerbaijani people. She has applied for a 500 AZN loan in order to purchase two baby calves.

loans.use: to purchase two calves.

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas Group

texts.es:
En la ciudad de San Lorenzo se reunieron 12 mujeres, quienes vieron en el programa de la fundación paraguaya una oportunidad de progreso y de ayuda. Ellas son mujeres trabajadoras, solidarias y muy humildes, quienes trabajan duro para poder ayudar a sus familias a salir adelante.
Una de ellas es la señora Mariela, quien por medio de la venta de ropas puede ayudar a su familia. Ella cuenta que este trabajo la ha ayudado a salir adelante y cubrir los gastos de la casa. Comenta que gracias a la buena calidad de los productos que vende, ha logrado formarse una clientela que siempre dejan de ella las prendas que vende.
Ella solicita el crédito para poder comprar shorts, camisillas, remeras, y otras prendas de verano, pues se acerca la época de calor y quiere estar preparada para ofrecerle a sus clientes.
texts.en:
In the city of San Lorenzo, 12 women got together who saw the Fundación Paraguaya program as an opportunity for progress and help. They are hard working, supportive and very humble women. They work hard to be able to help their families and get ahead. 

One of them is Mariela, who is able to help her family by selling clothes. She remarks that this job has helped her get ahead and cover the household expenses. She says that thanks to the good quality of the products she sells, she has established a clientele that always goes to her for the clothes she sells.  

She is asking for the loan to buy shorts, tank tops, t-shorts and other summer clothing. Warm weather is coming and she wants to be ready to offer these clothes to her customers.

loans.use: to buy shorts, tank tops, t-shorts, and other summer clothing.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase bulk maize and cassava.

loans.name: Mahammad

texts.en: Mahammad is a 30 year-old man who breeds sheep and cattle as well as cows. Mahammad is an IDP (internally displaced person) and lives with his wife and two children in Bilasuvar IDP Settlement. He has four years of experience in this field.  He sells milk and homemade yoghurt, as well as sheep for wool and meat purposes and cattle for meat purposes.  His monthly income is 250 AZN.
