To help expand her business, Yahia has requested a loan of 400,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more sugar, soap and cooking oil, and will help Yahia to generate greater profits and pay her child's school fees. Yahia hopes that in the future she will be able to buy a plot of land and build a house. 

Yahia is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training. The ELA program has increased Yahia's future prospects by helping her to learn how to save and manage her money.

loans.use: to purchase more sugar, soap and cooking oil.

loans.name: Livia

texts.es: La socia actualemnte se dedica  a la compra la por mayor D. ropa D. las diferentes tiendas grandes en Lima, Bolivia y otras y los venD. al por menor en Cusco, la socia viaja a comprar ropa para damas, caballeros y niños y los trae para vender ella actualmente tiene su stand en un conocido centro comercial D. la ciudad, la socia ha crecido mucho economicamente y tambien ahora que tiene su stand sigue trabajando el doble porque sus clientes aumentaron y ella desea invertir el prestamo para la compra D. ropa al por mayor y traer en esta temporada las nuevas novedades D. la capital del país y D. las diferentes tiendas y fabricas que estan allá. La socia desea invertir el prestamo en la compra D. ropa al por mayor.
texts.en: The borrower is currently engaged in buying clothes wolesale from different large stores in Lima, Bolivia and others and sells them retail in Cusco. The borrower travels to buy wholesale clothes for ladies, men and children for later resale. The borrower has a stand at a well-known commercial centre in the city. The borrower has grown a lot economically and also now she has her stand she continues to work twice as much as her number of customers increased. She wants to invest the loan in buying clothes wholesale and offer this seasons latest fashion developments of the capital from the different stores and factories located there. The borrower wants to invest the laon to buy clothes wholesale.

loans.use: to buy clothes wholesale.

loans.name: Tomas

texts.es:
El señor Tomas tiene 53 años de edad, esta acompañado con dos hijos.
Él aprendo los trabajos de la agricultura, desde los 10 años de edad. Fue su papá quien le enseño. Se levanta a las 3:00 a.m. para darle de comer a su ganado y luego los lleva al terreno que esta a tres kilómetros de su casa, luego se dirige a trabajar en su milpa durante cinco horas y en la tarde se va de jornal.   
Tomas debe abordar dos autobuses para ir a la ciudad donde compra los insumos agrícolas y el alimento para el ganado, una vez adquiere los insumos se regresa a su casa y tiene que caminar a pie hasta llegar a su casa.   
Él esta solicitando un préstamo a Fundación Campo, para comprar insumos agrícolas para su milpa y comprar una yunta de bueyes, para poder transportar los insumos y el alimento para el ganado hacia su vivienda. 
 Con esta inversión Tomas estará seguro de dar a sus cultivos un manejo adecuado y a tiempo; y venderlos a mejor precio. Al mismo tiempo se le facilitara el trasporte de los mismos a su vivienda y mandara a elaborar una carreta para que la halen los bueyes y transporten los insumos. 

De los ingresos que reciba, espera reparar su vivienda, ya que le hacen falta las puertas y ventanas, los cuales tiene cubiertos con láminas y se siente inseguro, por eso desea hacerlas de matal.
texts.en:
Señor Tomas is 53 years old. He has 2 children. 

He learned to farm from, starting when he was 10 years old. His father taught him. Tomas wakes up at 3:00 a.m. to feed his livestock and later he takes them to a pasture which is 3 kilometers from his house. After that, he goes to work in his fields for 5 hours, and in the afternoon, he works as a day laborer.

Tomas must take two buses in order to get to the city where he purchases agricultural inputs and feed for his cattle. After obtaining the inputs, he returns and must walk on foot to arrive at his house.

He is requesting a loan from Fundación Campo, in order to purchase agricultural inputs for his fields and to purchase a pair of oxen so that he can transport the inputs and the cattle feed to his residence.

With this investment, Tomas will be certain to adequately care for his crops on time, and sell them at a better price.  Additionally, it will facilitate transporting the crops to his home. He will have a wagon made for the oxen to pull and transport the inputs.

With the income he will receive, he hopes to repair his home because it needs doors and windows. They are currently covered with sheets, which makes him feel unsafe. He would like to have metal doors and windows.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural inputs for his fields and to purchase a pair of oxen.

loans.name: Teopista's Group

texts.en:
Teopista's group is comprised of two hard-working women. Teopista is 20 years old and lives in the town of Kachwamba in the Fort Portal region of Uganda. For the past year, Teopista has been working hard to manage her stand, which sells fresh produce and other foods. 

To help expand her business, Teopista has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more produce for resale, and it will help Teopista to generate greater profits and improve her family's standard of living. Teopista hopes that in the future she will be able to buy a plot of land and build a house. 

Teopista is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training. The ELA program has increased Teopista's future prospects by helping her to learn how to save money.

loans.use: to purchase more produce for resale.

loans.name: Ruth Miguelina

texts.es: La socia actualmente sigue con su negocio de compra y venta de ropa, la socia viaja a Lima y compra de las tiendas grandes las ofertas y cierres de temporadas, también compra de las fabricas todo tipo de ropa para damas, caballeros y niños, la socia tambien compra zapatos y zapatillas para niños y niñas; La socia esta muy contenta porque le esta yendo muy bien y esta teniendo buenos ingresos economicos que le permiten tener y dar a su familia una mejor calidad de vida; La socia desea invertir el prestamo en la compra de ropa al por mayor ella suele viajar a laciudad de Lima con frecuencia y ahora esta planeando su viaje la semana que viene para traer ropa y novedades para esta epoca navideña. La socia solicita el prestamo para invertir en la compra de ropa y zapatos.
texts.en: This member continues with her business buying and selling clothes.  She travels to Lima and buys clothes which are on offer in large stores and seasonal closeout merchandise.  She also buys from factories.  She buys all types of ladies', mens' and children's clothes.  She also buys boys' and girls' shoes and sneakers.  She is very happy because her business is doing very well and she is making good income which allows her to enjoy, and provide her family with, a better quality of life.  The member would like to invest her loan in buying clothes wholesale.  She usually travels to the city of Lima frequently and now she is planning her trip for next week.  She will bring back clothes and new items for the Christmas period.  She is requesting this loan to invest in buying clothes and shoes.

loans.use: to invest in buying clothes and shoes

loans.name: Cirace's Group

texts.en:
Cirace's group is comprised of two hard-working women. Cirace is 16 years old and lives in the town of Kachwamba in the Fort Portal region of Uganda. For the past three years, Cirace has been working hard to manage her business, raising and selling goats. 

To help expand her business, Cirace has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more young goats, and will help Cirace to generate greater profits and improve her family's standard of living. Cirace hopes that in the future she will be able to buy a plot of land and build a house. 

Cirace is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training. The ELA program has increased Cirace's future prospects by helping her to learn how to read, write, and manage her finances.

loans.use: to purchase more young goats.

loans.name: Lupe

texts.es: La señora   Lupe es cliente antigua de la institución en sus anteriores créditos demostró   responsabilidad  y puntualidad en el pago de sus cuotas la cliente vive en   la ciudad de La Paz, zona Los Andes, Lupe es casada  y tiene dos hijos que están en la edad escolar, la cliente  vende ropa para niños desde hace varios años, el préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de  ropa de niños por estas épocas de fin  de año por mayor ya que tiene mucha demanda,  la cliente se siente muy feliz por ser beneficiada con el crédito y agradecida con la institución.
texts.en: Señora Lupe is a long-standing member of the institution who was responsible and punctual with the repayments of her previous loans. The member lives in the city of La Paz in the Andes. Lupe is married and has 2 children who are of school age. The member has been selling children's clothes for several years. She will invest the loan in buying children's clothes wholesale for the end of year season as demand is high. The member is very happy to be benefiting from a loan and is grateful to the institution.

loans.use: to buy clothes, children's coats for Christmas.
